session_synopses.Butcher: This dialog is started by talking to the Butcher character in the Colony. The player may ask the Butcher questions or recruit them as a temporary follower inside the Colony. Alternatively, this dialog runs through a flag in case the player has already met the Butcher, or if the Butcher was recruited as a follower. The Butcher sounds eerily vacant unless otherwise specified, his mind destroyed by his time in Colony.

session_synopses.AD_Rapid01: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.
session_synopses.AD_Rapid02: Quick-fire Elder Brain ADs in the Colony corridors. If the party attacked Ketheric on the Moonrise Rooftop, there will be more frantic, fast-paced ADs from the Elder Brain surrounding us in quick succession, similar to when we approach the Elder Brain in the Morphic Pool. In this flow, the evacuation of the Colony is a lot more pressing because Ketheric was attacked.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The stench. I wonder how many pilgrimages to Moonrise ended down here.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Entering a room that smells disgusting

session_synopses.PAD: The party comments on the gruesome smell and/or appearance of the Colony's kitchen and dissection room.

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Is anyone else's tadpole squirming around a lot more than usual?

PAD_ElevatorBanter.speaker: Player
PAD_ElevatorBanter.text: Aye. Feels like something down here has them excited... or scared.

session_synopses.PAD_CallLiftFail: The player has tried to call the platform in COL while it's already at the level in question.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorBanter: A banter PAD when taking the elevator down to the Ketheric Showdown from the upper floor of the Colony. If there are two tadpoled players available, they will banter together, otherwise a solo PAD will play.

GrandDesignSculpture.speaker: Narrator
GrandDesignSculpture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of entire relief, dwarfing player

GrandDesignSculpture.speaker: Narrator
GrandDesignSculpture.text: *Your tadpole echoes. Not with presence, but memory - tinged with loss.*
GrandDesignSculpture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close-up of central figure, looming large with Brain above
CinematicNodeContext: Shots of the various scenes of torture on the sculpture, humanoid shapes bowed in agony

GrandDesignSculpture.speaker: Narrator
GrandDesignSculpture.text: *That loss blooms into a sudden fury, burying claws in your mind.*
GrandDesignSculpture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld effect, player in pain
CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld effect, player in pain

GrandDesignSculpture.speaker: Narrator
GrandDesignSculpture.text: *And just as suddenly, pain and memory are gone - leaving only stone once more.*
GrandDesignSculpture.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide shot of sculpture again, pulling out as player straightens.

GrandDesignSculpture.speaker: Lae'zel
GrandDesignSculpture.text: The Grand Design. It is every githyanki's duty to ensure the ghaik empire is never reborn.

session_synopses.GrandDesignSculpture: An interaction with the mind flayer sculpture depicting the Grand Design, as seen in the intro cutscene of the game in the Nautiloid. A psionic imprint tells you its story.

AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat.speaker: Kressa Bonedaughter
AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat.text: Not even the worms will want your carcass once I'm done with you!

AD_Minthara_EnteredBarracks.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredBarracks.text: Some who worked here were not thralls or undead. They were loyal to Ketheric and his grim cause.

AD_SkullLasher_002_Combat.speaker: Ironfinger
AD_SkullLasher_002_Combat.text: I will toast a goblet of your blood after you're dead!

AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat.speaker: Maghtew Budj
AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat.text: I shall make sweet music of your screams!

AD_SkullLasher_002_AttackDummy.speaker: Ironfinger
AD_SkullLasher_002_AttackDummy.context: NodeContext: attacking a training dummy and commenting after a blow has been struck

session_synopses.AD_MistressOfSouls_Combat: Krustine, Mistress of Souls in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_002_Combat: Ironfinger, a female halfling, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_003_Combat: Magthew Budj, a human male, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, combat AD. Played only once.
session_synopses.AD_SkullLasher_002_AttackDummy: Ironfinger, a female halfling, one of three Skull Lashers in the Colony Barracks, repeated behaviour AD for when she is attacking an attack dummy. She is preparing for war in the Absolute's army.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Pardon! Wouldn't do to phlegm all over Lord Gortash during my first performance, would it?
Memory_DeviceExplained.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coughing, clearing throatNodeContext: Clears throat before pardon

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Acoustics are a little off in here. Which is... where, exactly?

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Never mind that. Tell me about this Lord Gortash.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: He heard me singing in Beggar's Rest. Said he needed someone to 'give voice to lost knowledge'.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: A little over my head, being honest, but the lord has gold. I trust he knows his business. Now - I'd best warm up.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Player
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Snap out of it - and look around you.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pause while the fixed head takes in the illithid hall.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Could do with a bit of natural light, all right. But you know these nobles - odd as fae folk.

Memory_DeviceExplained.speaker: Slack-Skinned Head
Memory_DeviceExplained.text: Now, I need to prepare. Wish me luck!

session_synopses.Memory_DeviceExplained: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader" depicts an example memory, of Balthazar experimenting on a thrall in order to try out the brain reading device. The memory belongs to an enthralled subject.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A whole fleet of nautiloids. How many 'True Souls' have passed through this place?

session_synopses.PAD: While exploring the Colony, a player arrives at a precipice from which they can see a row of floating nautiloids.

AD_MintharaEntersLab.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_MintharaEntersLab.text: Whatever experiments Balthazar performed here, I fear he made more than thralls and ghouls.

PAD_RitualArea.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualArea.text: Curious setup. Think I'll keep my distance.

session_synopses.PAD_RitualArea: The players come upon a ritual setup where subjects are captured and held in glass containers while the magic drains their life and turns them into undead.

DaisyAD_ThroughPrison.text: An illithid oubliette. Right beneath the Towers. A colony must be close. That must be where the tadpoles are coming from.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_ThroughPrison: On arrival in colony. Through prisonAn illithid colony. Right under the tower. This must be where they are getting the tadpoles.

EnterRoom.speaker: Balthazar
EnterRoom.text: How often do I have to repeat myself? No disturbances.
EnterRoom.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar is interrupted from his necromancy by the player's intrusion and turns around to face them with hostilityNodeContext: Irate, distracted

EnterRoom.speaker: Balthazar
EnterRoom.text: Wait - you're no underling of mine. Far too intact for my tastes. That means you're a trespasser.

AD_ZombieErrand.speaker: Balthazar
AD_ZombieErrand.text: Too feeble by far. This needs muscle; the stronger, the better.
AD_ZombieErrand.context: NodeContext: Engrossed in his work, Ordering zombie lackeys about.

AD_ZombieErrandDone.speaker: Balthazar
AD_ZombieErrandDone.text: Stop dawdling - it's not as though you have somewhere better to be.

AD_Combat_ResendZombie.speaker: Balthazar
AD_Combat_ResendZombie.context: NodeContext: Urgent command to a zombie lackey during combat

session_synopses.EnterRoom: A player walked into Balthazar's chambers in the colony, while Balthazar is alive, and was spotted by him (or one of his undead). Balthazar reacts with hostility, but players can convince him that they have been turned into thralls.This can only happen if Balthazar is alive at this point and you didn't try the Audience with the Absolute. If you did not send Nightsong to Ketheric, Balthazar would have died in combat in her prison.This dialog will also play when interacting with Balthazar in this route.
session_synopses.AD_ZombieErrand: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. He's sending zombies off on errands.
session_synopses.AD_ZombieErrandDone: The necromancer is standing over a bowl of blood and bone, conducting a ritual to see the future. He's sending zombies off on errands.The zombie returns, and he reacts.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_ResendZombie: The necromancer is sending a zombie to light the candles that start an arcane ritual which drains the player's hitpoints and ultimately turns them into a zombie, after the player has extinguished them.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You said it was under control.
ChosenThree.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?

ChosenThree.speaker: Orin
ChosenThree.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?

ChosenThree.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
ChosenThree.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

ChosenThree.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
ChosenThree.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -

DaisyAD_ElderBrain.text: An elder brain... One of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

DaisyAD_EntranceDoor.text: We've found it. The Absolute is behind this door.

PAD_NightsongCaged.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongCaged.text: So long as Nightsong's in that cage, Ketheric will keep getting back up.

AD_Phase3Transition.text: UNLIFE TO MY LIFE - SUSTAIN ME, SLAVES.

AD_NightsongApostle.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongApostle.text: Now you wear a face to match your soul, oathbreaker.
AD_NightsongApostle.context: NodeContext: Scorn in the heat of battle - her nemesis has just turned into a hideous monster

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

KethericIntro.speaker: Player
KethericIntro.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of Faerûn to death.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

KethericIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericIntro.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: Impossible... death cannot take me... I am its master...
KethericDefeated.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Apostle lurches back as the final blow is struck. It sinks towards the ground, growing more insubstantial as it falls. 

It fades to nothing, leaving only Ketheric, who staggers, holding a hand to a bloody wound over his heart

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: calling out to his god, hands held wide, displaying the wound for the cameraNodeContext: growing desperation as you call on your god

KethericDefeated.text: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: he falls to his knees

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext: head bowed, he speaks from his knees, fear in his voiceNodeContext: fear in your voice - tried to speak to your god, but there was no response

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.text: You... you have no idea what you've done.

KethericDefeated.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
KethericDefeated.context: CinematicNodeContext:  he locks eyes with the player on the first 'you', a horrified expression on his face. The flesh falls away after he has spoken, leaving only a skull, that crashes to the ground, rolling away from his armour, now containing little but dust and shattered bones

DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone.text: Ketheric's Netherstone - it's in his armour. Take it.

session_synopses.ChosenThree: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_ElderBrain: The Elder Brain. One of the cruelest and most powerful creatures that exist. Subservient to those three. And those gems seem to be the key. We must obtain them.
session_synopses.PAD_NightsongCaged: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, while the combat has started and Nightsong is still soul caged. The players must free her before Ketheric can be damaged. Once the first (speaker available) player gets their turn in combat, this AD will play on them.
session_synopses.AD_Phase3Transition: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, when the third phase of the fight starts, this will play only once on Ketheric when his turn starts. Ketheric, in his Apostle of Myrkul form, calls upon the Necromites to sacrifice themselves to heal him.
session_synopses.AD_NightsongApostle: This AD plays during the Ketheric Showdown in the lower Colony, after Ketheric has transformed into his Apostle form/reached his second stage, Nightsong will react to this upon her first combat turn after this.
session_synopses.KethericIntro: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
session_synopses.KethericDefeated: NOTE TO PITSTOP: We have a cinematic previz of this so be sure to ping for that if we haven't already sent it to you.This dialog plays after defeating Ketheric once and for all at the Colony Ketheric Showdown. Ketheric delivers a short speech before he dies.- If Nightsong's corpse is present in the chamber, she will revive. If she is alive by this point she will comment on finally being rid of Ketheric.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_GrabNetherstone: After the fight with Ketheric, Daisy asks us to grab Ketheric's Netherstone.

AD_MizoraInPod.text: Bastards. Can't conjure so much as a fireball in this thing.

session_synopses.AD_MizoraInPod: Mizora in a pod in COLony

PAD_IntellectDevourerComment.speaker: Player
PAD_IntellectDevourerComment.text: They're not attacking. Seems they think we're allies.

session_synopses.PAD_IntellectDevourerComment: The party interacts with any of the intellect devourers in the Colony, and says this line after the intellect devourers are done speaking. They say this only once.Intellect devourer lines are in: COL_GEN_AD_IntellectDevourer_1cde5899-11a9-e82f-a49d-f038a554490eThey're just generic, neutral lines.

Pod.speaker: Narrator
Pod.text: *A fleshy carapace, securely sealed. It emits a noiseless hum that makes your tadpole shiver.*

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Gale
PAD_GrandDesign.text: I wonder, how did the Illithid Empire fall?

PAD_GrandDesign.speaker: Karlach, Lae'zel, Shadowheart
PAD_GrandDesign.text: Probably with a great gooey bang.

AD_Solving.speaker: Mind of the Vault
AD_Solving.context: InternalNodeContext: Partial lucidity (3 out of 3 brain parts activated; fully lucid in following lines as puzzle is now solved)NodeContext: Mechanically distorted speech; almost "normal"

session_synopses.Pod: Player interacts with any individual pod.Each individual pod requires a separate tadpole use to open.
session_synopses.AD_Solving: AD occasionally played as the player solves the puzzle, providing feedback to the player.

AD_Us_FollowPlayer.speaker: Us
AD_Us_FollowPlayer.text: We must flee - lead Us to safety, friend.

AD_Butcher_Idle.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Idle.text: Pretty faces go chop... faces? No - no faces, only meat. Never think, never stop. Only chop. Chop. CHOP.
AD_Butcher_Idle.context: NodeContext: Brief note of lucidity on '...faces?' as he seems momentarily aware of his condition - then shakes it off and returns to his work rhythm a little more forcefully.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.context: NodeContext: Recognition/excited ('helm' referencing their previous adventures to get to a nautiloid helm during the tutorial)

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: We remember you well. You saved Us once. Perhaps you can do it again?

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They are not kind to Us here. We are different, they say. Aberrant.

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: They wish to repurpose Us - destroy what they cannot fix. Please, help Us escape harm!

Us.speaker: Us
Us.text: But we need your help! Friend is not kind. Friend is perhaps no friend at all...

AD_Butcher_Death.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_Death.text: Death. Free at last. No more chop, chop, chop...
AD_Butcher_Death.context: NodeContext: Relieved, dying breath, Flicker of lucidity as he's finally freed from mental enslavement.

AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.speaker: Chop
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.text: Head full of red. No want chop. Make it stop. Make me stop.
AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001.context: NodeContext: Anguished moment of lucidity mid-combat, begging the player to free him (kill him) even while possessed to attack.

session_synopses.AD_Us_FollowPlayer: This AD plays upon freeing Us from its cage in the Colony Morgue, without triggering a crime reaction from Chop, the Colony Butcher. In that case, Us will start following the first player they see (or the player that got them out) and request to get out of the Morgue and to safety.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Idle: Sequential, repeated AD for Chop, the Colony butcher. He will say a line every few seconds while in his idle behaviour. Chop is generally enjoying his job, but something deep beneath his enthralled exterior realizes the horror of his reality. Some of these lines could be considered a little bit song-like - Chop would be humming to himself while working.
session_synopses.Us: Default dialogue with Us while they are in the Colony. Us is either locked in a cage in the Morgue, trying to sneak away from the Butcher, or thanking you for saving them, after which they will disappear.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_Death: This AD plays when Chop, the Colony Butcher, dies. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.
session_synopses.AD_Butcher_CombatTurn001: This AD plays during combat with Chop, the Colony Butcher. Chop will fight you because he is enthralled, but has a secret desire to be put out of his misery.

PAD_DefeatedKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.text: An elder brain... That was the Heart of the Absolute?
PAD_DefeatedKetheric.context: NodeContext: Almost to self, processing this information

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: All of this, sitting beneath Moonrise. For how long? And how deep does it go?
PAD.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel line: teh-LA TAHV-key (spirits guide me)

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: Of all the beastly lairs I've had to poke my nose into - an illithid colony is still by far the worst.
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.context: InternalNodeContext:  Referencing Bhaalspawn/Abdel (Unsure if it's a canon adventure? Might be)

PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.speaker: Player
PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn.text: I think we have more pressing concerns than a trip down memory lane.

session_synopses.PAD: PAD discussing the Colony, how eerie it is, and reflecting on the (similar) nautiloid at the beginning of the game.Started through COL_Entrance_VBFor Wyll: discussing either his mission to save his father or Mizora.
session_synopses.PAD_NeverThoughtWouldReturn: Jaheira comments about returning to a mindflayer colony, which Laez'al, Wyll and Astarion comment on. It's mentioned that this is Jaheira reflecting on coming to one of these with Abdel Adrian,

session_synopses.PAD: The player witnesses a bloody corpse rolling out of the chute in the Cleansing Room of the lower Mind Flayer Colony, coming in from the Oubliette. This PAD is their reaction to seeing this, and connecting it to Moonrise above.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The door pulses in recognition.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *But in denial, too. It will not open, even for you.*

session_synopses: Dialogue when approaching the door at the end of the Colony that precedes the Ketheric Showdown - once you're inside, it remains locked from the inside until Ketheric is defeated.The COL_EntranceDoor_State_Outside flag indicates on what side the player is.

session_synopses.ResonanceStone_PAD: The players react to gaining or losing the "Eldritch Pleasure" status effect from the Resonance Stone in the secret sideroom of the Colony kitchen/dissection room. This status is applied or removed upon gaining the "Eldritch Pleasure" buff bestowed by the aura effect of the Resonance Stone, and will only play once per user and nearby player. The removal dialog will only trigger upon losing the buff while inside a trigger near the Colony kitchen, as to avoid it playing unexpectedly during later parts of the game.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Looks like it siphons power from anyone lying in that cradle. Wonderful.

session_synopses.PAD: Players are trying to use a recovery pod (like in the tutorial) that's disabled because there's nobody in the attached bed (or pod, art still TBD).

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer.text: *Desperation... pain... terror. Cultists raided his village - he was the sole survivor.*

AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *You remember the shattered windows of Elturel's High Cathedral, the burning black sky of Avernus beyond.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *In its horror, the Blood War unites you. Tiefling, dwarf and elf alike huddle behind the shields of your paladin order, waiting for salvation. But when it comes... disunity.*

AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor.text: *The returned city casts your people out, the devils who dragged them down to hell. In the end, it is not your paladin oath that is broken: it is your faith itself.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *You connect to the device, and gain control of the pods - and the fate of their occupants.*

Pods.speaker: Narrator
Pods.text: *The device is open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*

PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.speaker: Player
PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole.text: An unusual parasite, here. It's - it's reaching out to me.

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer.text: *Courage... conviction... defiance. Even as her organs began to dissolve, she believed she could resist.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer.text: *Delirium... mania... laughter. His mind broke before the end, and he was laughing uncontrollably as the skin fell from his face.*

DaisyAD_BrinePool.text: Brine pools... but empty of tadpoles. Unusual. Harvesting all the larvae indicates they are getting ready for something big.

AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty.text: *The device does not react to your presence.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *The device releases a stream of fragmented memories and emotions - all that remains of the pod inhabitant's former self.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *Your lungs burn with the dry heat of the fires raging about you, but the pain is not enough to diminish your swing. One goblin after another falls to your blade.*

AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.speaker: Narrator
AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva.text: *A man's voice cries out through the thick smoke. 'Ravengard!' you call, but the clang of swords and the spell-shouts of attacking drow are your only reply.*

AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredTadpolingCenter.text: This place has been used to make slaves of those who should be masters.

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *This pod has a different air to its chitinous cavern. Dust and dirt are gathered on the inside.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *It's broken beyond repair. Seemingly by a blunt impact, as if whoever was inside threw themselves against it in an effort to break out.*
DarkUrgePod.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge bends down next to the pod, to look into the area beyond the glass, it doesn't have to be shown

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *Your brain hurls an image towards you. Your own head-blood gushing down in front of your eyes.*

DarkUrgePod.speaker: Narrator
DarkUrgePod.text: *You were in the pod a long, long while, but it seems you have no recollection of ever entering the nautiloid.*

AD_Zevlor_Pod.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Zevlor_Pod.context: NodeContext: Recalling when the ambush went wrong - his people started to fight and die

PostCombat_Manip.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip.text: Hurr, what a stench. I'm beginning to think I should have stayed in that pod. In there it only smelled like me.

PostCombat_Manip.speaker: Manip Shuurga
PostCombat_Manip.text: Is there any news about Duke Ravengard? Did he get out alive? No, I can tell by your expression. I'm going to have to fall on my sword, aren't I?

session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_003_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_004_Mindflayer: AD for a memory imprint on an empty pod in the Tadpoling Centre.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_006_Zevlor: AD for Zevlor's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before he was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.Pods: Interacting with the mind flayer device in the Tadpoling Centre that controls the pods inside. You get to choose whether to free or purge the occupants of the pods - mind flayers and innocents alike.
session_synopses.PAD_BrinePool_Tadpole: The party reacts to spotting a special tadpole in one of the brine pools of the Colony Tadpoling Centre. It can be used for the tadpole powers tree.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_005_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_007_Mindflayer: AD for a mind flayer's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing who they used to be when they entered the pod.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_BrinePool: Brine pools. But they’ve been harvested. They should be full of tadpoles.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_009_Empty: AD for an empty pod's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from whoever was imprisoned here before.
session_synopses.AD_MemoryImprint_008_Yeva: AD for Flaming Fist Yeva's memory imprint in the Tadpoling Centre, showing a memory from before she was imprisoned here.
session_synopses.DarkUrgePod: A player character interacts with a pod in the Tadpoling Centre that once belonged to the Dark Urge character. Other player characters may also investigate the pod, and imply something about who the pod belonged to if they succeed a skill check.
session_synopses.AD_Zevlor_Pod: Repeated ADs from Zevlor, while he is (alive) inside one of the Colony's Tadpoling Centre pods. He is a bit dazed, mumbling about the events that lead up to his capture, mixed with traumatic memories of Elturel, Avernus, and his exile from his paladin order.
session_synopses.PostCombat_Manip: Dialogue with a Flaming Fist Manip, Ravengard's search officer, after freeing her from her pod in the Colony Tadpoling Centre.

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: Our enemies spread like rub-rot - treat one patch, and two more bloom in its place.

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: An elder brain, bound by lost Netherese magic, with servants of the Dead Three holding the chain.
Debrief.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: You almost seem like you're enjoying yourself.

Debrief.speaker: Player
Debrief.text: I'm having the time of my life.

Debrief.speaker: Jaheira
Debrief.text: It is good to savour the moment of victory - but pace yourself. Our fight is just beginning.

session_synopses.Debrief: In the aftermath of the battle in the colony, Jaheira reflects on next steps and officially asks to join our party.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Who were you before the Absolute claimed you?

Dead.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Dead.text: Destined to be... matron mother... House Baenre...

PAD_ToBaldursGate.speaker: Player
PAD_ToBaldursGate.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is west of the town. If we hurry, we'll arrive before the Absolute's forces.

PAD_ShadowCurseNotLifted.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowCurseNotLifted.text: Ketheric may be gone, but the shadows remain. On our guard.
PAD_ShadowCurseNotLifted.context: NodeContext: SH: 'the shadow curse remains' = SH has abandoned Shar. 'Lady Shar's power persists' = SH loyal to shar.

PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.speaker: Player
PAD_UnfinishedBusiness.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is up ahead. No turning back, once we start down that road.

session_synopses.PAD_ToBaldursGate: After leaving Ketheric's throne room after Ketheric's defeat, a player character comments on what they need to do next - head for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowCurseNotLifted: If the shadow curse wasn't lifted, the party will remark that we still need protection against the curse despite Ketheric having been defeated.
session_synopses.PAD_UnfinishedBusiness: After the act 2 epilogue, the party comments on resolving unfinished business before moving on to Baldur's Gate/act 3.

000.speaker: Flaming Fist
000.text: Safely on to Baldur's Gate. For all of us.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Ah! There you are. This is Aylin. Aylin, this is -

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: We have met. The instigator of my despair - and then my elation.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: We must watch this one closely, Isobel. Their motivations are suspect - aye, suspect indeed.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: Hmm - it sounds like we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: I have more to thank you for than I knew. And we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Firstly, allow me to apologise to Dame Aylin. My actions were strategy - not personal.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: My forgiveness will be the same. I'd be a fool to turn down a powerful ally - especially one who has earned the trust of fair Isobel.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: But Dame Aylin's life is neverending. And she does not forget. Now - I believe Isobel asked a question of you. We will meet you in your camp - is it agreed?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a little crowded already.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: We'll make our visit brief. Cleric's honour.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I doubt that. You go your way, and I'll go mine.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: We are not welcome, my love. No matter. We will hie us to the Hill of the Headless Dancer and bare our flesh beneath the cleansing light of the moon's soft gaze.

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: A hundred years hasn't changed you at all, my love. As for you - if we aren't to meet again, I'll say my thank-yous. And my goodbyes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: If we meet again, it will be my pleasure.

session_synopses: If Isobel and Nightsong survive Act 2 they will be having a heartfelt reunion during the Epilogue

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I found Mol's eyepatch.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: This is Mol's... Where did you find it?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost accusatory

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Somewhere unpleasant. But I didn't see Mol - she's probably safe somewhere.

node_data.speaker: Ide
node_data.text: 'Course she is! You hang onto that - I bet Mol'll be angry at you for touching her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Defiant but secretly a little relieved - she's glad the player didn't say Mol was dead

session_synopses: Ide is frustrated by Alfira's attempts to cheer her and the other tiefling kids up - she's more worried about Mol (who is missing).

AD.speaker: Withers
AD.text: Make haste. I would have words with you.
AD.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

session_synopses.AD: Jergal is always present at the epilogue and will try to call for the player's attention. He has important things to say to the player in his debrief about the dead three and what to do next. It will only play before SCE_Jergal_Debrief triggers.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Thaniel rests still, but it's no easy slumber.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: The shadows rended him in two when they bore him away to the Shadowfell. Half of his essence remained here, amidst the curse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: What stayed behind would have been the strongest part of him. But after all these years left in darkness, corruption must have taken hold.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Tell me how I can help.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: It's both simple and not - we need to find Thaniel's missing half, and make him whole again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Only, the missing half may not come willingly. The curse will have sunk its tendrils deep, twisting Thaniel's essence into something... else.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Some foreboding. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll see what I can do, but no promises.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Let me help you then. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: If you want me, I'm yours. Against the curse, against the Absolute - anything. Just say the word.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Stalwart, heartfelt

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Join me.

node_data.speaker: Halsin
node_data.text: Good. Now our roots can deepen - together.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute/comradely

session_synopses: Dialogue with Halsin in the epilogue of Act 2. In it, he reacts to the various states that could occur in relation to his desire to rid the Act 2 region of the shadow curse:- if you've already done everything needed to ensure success. he's grateful and seeks to remain with you on the journey to Baldur's Gate.- if the curse is not yet sure to be lifted, but there's still something that can be done (ie Thaniel was saved from the Shadowfell, but hasn't been fully restored), he will implore the players to help and offer to join them.- if it's no longer possible to lift the curse, Halsin is sad and resigned to staying behind to stand sentry over it. He will not be available as a companion in Act 3, and his story effectively ends here.

node_data.speaker: Alfira
node_data.text: Ah! A fellow bard. Sorry to ask out of the blue, but would you like to play together?
node_data.context: NodeContext: cheerful and excited

node_data.speaker: Alfira
node_data.text: The kids have been really down - I figured a concert would cheer them up. Or distract them, at least. What do you say?
node_data.context: NodeContext: sincere and excited

node_data.speaker: Alfira
node_data.text: It'd be like a private concert, just for them - they'd love it!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let's see what you've got.

node_data.speaker: Alfira
node_data.text: Hah! Just try and keep up.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cheeky and playful

session_synopses: Alfira is leading the kids in a bit of fun moment of constructing their story into a ballad of sorts. When the player arrives they will have just finished up the lyrics and if the player is a bard, Alfira will invite them to play along with. At the end of the duet (gameplay playing animation with music, not a full cinematic) the Bard is given the Shining Dawn ability.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Back in Last Light, I was racking my brains - how the hells do we get past the curse?

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: And then, a blinding light cuts through the darkness, like a blade through butter. All thanks to you, I hear.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: Didn't think we'd make it without the old Hellrider to lead us. But you did a damn fine job.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: People get paid for doing jobs - cough up the coin.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: If I had coin, I wouldn't be travelling overland through a cursed warzone.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: If you ever need help again - ask somebody else.

node_data.speaker: Cerys
node_data.text: You're worse than Zevlor - at least he didn't put a price on our survival.

session_synopses: Cerys is preparing to lead the surviving tieflings onwards to Baldur’s Gate. Shocked to have survived the Shadow-Cursed Lands, she finds herself taking responsibility for the others - in Zevlor’s absence. It’s not a role she ever wanted, but somebody has to do it. She’s adjusting to a life without Zevlor, and briefly reflects on his surrender and presumed death.

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: You need to eat before we head off, all right?

NimbleAndNickels.speaker: Nimble
NimbleAndNickels.text: Do you have anything to eat?
NimbleAndNickels.context: NodeContext: suspicious, realising nickles answered too easily

Umi.speaker: Umi
Umi.text: Maybe I should ask the grown-ups to look for Mol again.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Mol is gonna be waiting for us at the gates of the city - I know it.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Just focus on packing - don't think about Mol.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: It's finally time for the Ironhand Gnomes to come home.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: eager, excited to return to the city

Nimble.speaker: Nimble
Nimble.text: Wulbren will get us to the city - I know it.

session_synopses.NimbleAndNickels: Back and forth between nimble and nickels in the tower.
session_synopses.UnfortunateGnome: This occurs in the epilogue. In the top set Wulbren has died and barcus is considering his next steps. In the bottom, Wulbren is alive and barcus is determined to do everything he can to help him.
session_synopses.Umi: Umi is worried about Mol, who is missing. In the top set, the player has down Umi Mol's eyepatch - hinting that she's dead. She's scared for her friend. In the bottom set, she's anxiously worried for her friend.
session_synopses.Ide: Ide is worried about Mol. In the top set of ADs, the player has shown Ide Mol's eyepatch - hinting that she might be dead. She's in stern denial about the possibility. In the bottom set, she's looking around anxiously, waiting for her leader.
session_synopses.Mattis: In the top nodes, the player has shown Mattis mol's eyepatch - implying that she's dead. He's distracted and just trying to focus on packing and getting ready - even though he's worried for Mol. In the bottom, he's eager to go and is scavaging Moonrise for stuff he can sell.
session_synopses.Wulbren: These ADs occur in the epilogue. In one set, Wulbren is admiring the stonework in front of him, and contemplating the artistry of Moonrise Towers. In the other, it's his idle behaviour as he prepares to leave for Baldur's Gate - excited for his plans to all come together.
session_synopses.Nimble: Nimble is in moonrise towers, preparing to leave for the city. In the top set of nodes wulbren is dead, and she is feeling lost and sad. In the bottom, wulbren is alive (nickels is dead) and she is doing her best to get organised, while fighting her grief over the loss of her friend.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You have defeated Ketheric Thorm, yet you who were content to leave Dame Aylin in his thrall until it served you best. How do you account for it?

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Isobel is dead. But you live - you who were content to leave me in the thrall of foul Ketheric Thorm.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It was strategy - not personal.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: Not personal for you, perhaps. You played a game of life and death, using mine as a chip in your pile.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I will not forget it. But nor will I turn down a powerful ally in the fight for Faerûn.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I am Dame Aylin. Daughter of the Moonmaiden, Selûne; champion of her causes in this fine realm.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: If you seek to protect it, our aims are aligned - even if you've much to learn about the methods of a true champion.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: I will join your camp, that we may discuss what must needs be discussed.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: See you there.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: You certainly will.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She bows at the end

session_synopses: The player has a chance to catch up with Nightsong if she survived Act 2, and Isobel is dead

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: It's... like... like your mind wants you dead.

AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_ArtAndFlamingFist.text: Thaniel. I had to look after him. Without him, I wouldn't have lasted long.

session_synopses.AD_ArtAndFlamingFist: Art has been cursed for a long time and finally has been freed from the curse. At the epilogue, he will be chatting with another harper about how it felt if he is cured and available.

AD_GnomeAndCat.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat.text: I'll be out of your way as soon as I'm finished...

Gnome001.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001.text: I suppose this place will do for now. Better than a cell in the Towers, at the very least.
Gnome001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.NodeContext: Arrogance; player has saved him and brought him here.

Gnome001.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001.text: I'd thank you for your help, but I doubt you need to hear such trivialities. So I'll just say fare-thee-well.

session_synopses.AD_GnomeAndCat: Overhead text of Barcus Wroot casually interacting with His Majesty, the local cat.
session_synopses.Gnome001: This gnome was saved from Moonrise Jail by the players.

AD_Jahiera.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jahiera.text: Strike like lightning! Roar like thunder! Wash over them with a blizzard's fury!

Outro.text: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat. This node is where Jaheira knows player caused the Shadow Siege by killing/kidnapping Isobel and caused everyone to die in Haven.
Outro.context: InternalNodeContext: Player and Jaheira gather in Haven yard after combat. This node is where Jaheira knows player caused the Shadow Siege by killing/kidnapping Isobel and caused everyone to die in Haven.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: It is abominable that you still live - you who has cost us so much. The murderer of light.
Outro.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Jaheira eyes us with hatred. She’s breathing heavily, exhausted by combat against the shadow creatures. She looks down - but she’s not out.NodeContext: Shes exhausted from combat, but her hatred of us keeps her standing.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: These dead need not be buried. Beneath this canopy of darkness, all is one yard of restless graves.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: You will lie and rot among them.
Outro.context: NodeContext: Fiery, spat at the player

Outro.speaker: Player
Outro.text: No, Jaheira. You mistake your own fate for mine.

Outro.speaker: Jaheira
Outro.text: You bluff, I call. Let's see who has the upper hand.

session_synopses.AD_Jahiera: Part of Jaheira behaviour during Siege in the basement. Walks among the harpers and cheers them during battle. Martial. in command. Powerful.
session_synopses.Outro: After the battle against the shadows is over, we speak with Jaheira again. Either she hates us because she knows we killed Isobel, or she's contemplative in the aftermath of the battle, and we can have her join our camp.

node_data.speaker: Nightsong
node_data.text: |Greeting.|

node_data.speaker: Isobel
node_data.text: |Isobel answer.|

session_synopses: Nightsong in the Inn after being saved from Shar Temple. Isobel suppose to be somewhere nearby.

AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
AD_Combat_HarperQuartermaster.text: Get back in the trash pile where you belong!

AD_Combat_DockGuard_Ranger.speaker: Harper Naysa
AD_Combat_DockGuard_Ranger.text: Got a blade with your name on it!

AD_Combat_BarricadeGuards_Melee_Dwarf.speaker: Harper Darragh
AD_Combat_BarricadeGuards_Melee_Dwarf.text: I'll cut you down to size!

JaheiraCallToArm.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraCallToArm.text: To arms! Protect Isobel at all cost!
JaheiraCallToArm.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus should be on the shoulders up to obscure whether or not Jaheira has a weapon in hand (cannot be guaranteed).NodeContext: Shouted during the onset of battle

PAD_SpyTransformationClue.speaker: Player
PAD_SpyTransformationClue.text: Someone - something - shed Flaming Fist armour like a second skin.

IsobelSaved.speaker: Isobel
IsobelSaved.context: NodeContext: Doubled over coughing but telling player not to worry about her.

CoolingDown.speaker: Isobel
CoolingDown.context: NodeContext: A little out-of-breath-- you just defeated Marcus after hte kidnapping scene and are waiting for Jaheira to arrive.

session_synopses.JaheiraCallToArm: Isobel is being attacked. Jaheira calls people to defend Isobel, as their lives depend on her.This dialog can happen anywhere in Last Light, but mainly close to Isobel's room.
session_synopses.PAD_SpyTransformationClue: If we go up on the roof above Isobel’s room, we’ll find discarded FF armour and some bloodstains from a transformation of some kind. A successful med check shows someone burst out of their armour (Marcus)
session_synopses.IsobelSaved: Once the Flaming Fist has been defeated, a shaken Isobel urges players who helped her to go and assist with the fight in the main room. She is coughing and unwell.
session_synopses.AD_SpyWaiting: Fallback AD if the player clicks on the flaming spy while Isobel is unavailable, or he's somehow forced out of Isobel's room while trying to start HAV_TakingIsobel_FlamingSpy.
session_synopses.CoolingDown: Isobel has a one-liner in case the player clicks on her while Jaheira is running up to her to do a dual dialog after Marcus' failed attempt at kidnapping Jaheira.
session_synopses.BriefInRoom: Isobel is in her room re-casting the spell that is protecting the inn. After she spots you, she gives you information about Ketheric and a spell to protect you from the shadowcurse.After Isobel gives this information, she is interrupted by the Absolute-tadpoled Flaming Fist, who attempts to kidnap her.
session_synopses.AD_ReactingToRoofNoise: The player is walking on the roof above Isobel's room and VoiceBarking about the Flaming Spy's transformation leftovers. Isobel reacts if she is close enough to hear.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
Bard.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: You're here. You're all right - how?
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: her friend, who she thought was dead, is safe and well. Astonished, grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: We're 'two tiefling queens', remember? I couldn't leave my favourite bard without her partner in crime.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: alfira thought lakrissa dead - lakrissa is enjoying seeing alfira's face and is being playful and cheeky

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I did have some help from an old friend though.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: reference to player, grateful and playful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: still astonished, trying to figure out how player managed to save lakrissa

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: NodeContext: grateful - knows player had to hurt people to save her friend.

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: I never thought I'd see... well, anyone, again.
ReunionWithFlirty.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Delighted and grateful

ReunionWithFlirty.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty.text: Thank you - a thousand times, thank you. One last favour? Take this off my hands - it suits you better.

session_synopses.Bard: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
session_synopses.ReunionWithFlirty: Lakrissa has been resuced from Moonrise by the player and is reunuined with her closest friend, Alfira.

AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Combat_Jaheira_000.text: You should have stayed in your tower.

PAD_Found.speaker: Player
PAD_Found.text: This is what Marcus buried? A dead Flaming Fist?
PAD_Found.context: NodeContext: surprise at the dead body - player was expecting valuables of some kind

session_synopses.PAD_Found: The players discovered the corpse of a Flaming Fist underneath a pile of rocks. There is a hint to this in marcus' SWD.

Spirit.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit.text: You did it. Ketheric Thorm is no more - the shadows' grip is broken. Soon the land shall heal.

Spirit.speaker: Player
Spirit.text: My work here is done, I think.

Spirit.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit.text: It is. But mine is just beginning again. Soon this will be a place of sunlight and greenery again, with birdsong honouring your triumph.

Spirit.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit.text: Nature moves at its own pace, and bestows its bounty when it sees fit. Give it time - a reward shall come to you, when you need it most.

session_synopses.Spirit: The player tries to interact with Thaniel, the spirit of the land, after Halsin rescues him from the Shadowfell. Thaniel is unconscious/unresponsive however.Later - Thaniel is recovering and able to talk. A somewhat otherworldly, wise far beyond his years 'child'. He instructs you on what comes next/offers his thanks once you have succeeded.

session_synopses.ARENA_Wave0: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 0 of enemies spawning
session_synopses.ARENA_Wave1: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 1 of enemies spawning
session_synopses.ARENA_Wave2: Arena Cam for Halsins Lakeside Combat for Wave 2 of enemies spawning

Harper_000.speaker: Harper Lassandra
Harper_000.text: You made it through the dark? Lucky you - not everyone does.

Harper_000.speaker: Harper Lassandra
Harper_000.text: He was a good Harper. A good friend.

AD_Arrival_Harper_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_Arrival_Harper_003.text: Wasn't sure we'd see light again.

session_synopses.AD_Arrival_Harper_001: Single-shot AD when the Harpers arrive back into Haven from the ambush in the shadow-curse where one of their own, Yonas, is killed by shadow creatures. Relieved but sad.
session_synopses.Harper_000: Dialogue in Haven for one of the harper scouts you helped in SCL (SCL_HarperScouts_ShadowCreatures). She is mourning Yonas' death and gives some information about the shadow curse.
session_synopses.AD_Arrival_Harper_003: One-shot Harper AD after arriving back in Haven post the attack on the Harper contingent that leaves Yonas dead. Sad but relieved.

001.speaker: Harper Mijah
001.text: Glad you made it through the dark.
001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: Sincere - you know what could have happened out there

session_synopses.001: Mijah is calm, cool and collected. Despite her young age Mijah has seen more than her fair share of fights. She is an excellent example of a Harper Veteran. This dialogue covers all main states in Haven.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: Mol would do the same for any of us. You know it.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Determined. Ide would die for Mol. Arguing everyone should leave and save her.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: But how do we get into Moonrise? We can't fight those shadow things.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Afraid. Trying to be the voice of reason.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Mirkon
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: We could! I beat up those harpies and they're way scarier than shadows.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Surprisingly confident. This is Mirkon's moment to be an adventurer he'd always dreamed. (he didn't actually beat up the harpies)

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: You know what Mol would hate more than anything? Bad things happening to us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Trying to be smart and calculated.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: You've seen what's out there. We wouldn't stand a chance.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: You don't know what you're talking about - Mol's a survivor.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack.text: We'll see her again. She's twice the hero you'll ever be.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: I can't wait to get outta this dump and never come back. Grab what you can before we scarper, yeah?
Mattis.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning fo the sentence. Excited ot get out. Sick of the place.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Check it out - we've gone legitimate, and Mol put me in charge. Whaddya need?

Mattis.speaker: Player
Mattis.text: You got any stock for an extra special customer like me?

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Hmm. I'm not supposed to mention it to anyone, but I do have something pretty special in stock. A key.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: What does it look like? What does it open? What treasures await behind its lock? That's for one lucky buyer to find out.

Mattis.speaker: Mattis
Mattis.text: Mol gave it to me, said I shouldn't let it go to just any old jack-a-day.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Yeah, 'cause she did a great job protecting Mol.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Maybe we should ask someone else?
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: kind of coming around to umi's thinking

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.text: Who? No one cares - no one but us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.context: NodeContext: determined - feeling like she's on her own

session_synopses.AD_Mattis: AD for Mattis, a cheeky Dodger type character selling trinkets in the Last Light Inn. Mattis is shouting out, trying to draw customers in.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerFoundTreasure_UmisComment: AD in which Umi sees the player finding a treasure. Disappointed because he'd been looking for a cool treasure and had found nothing.
session_synopses.KidsAfterGhoulAttack: Group dialogs for Tiefling kids when Mol is kidnapped. Ide, Mattis, Umi (and Mirkon, if he survived the harpy attack in the grove) are planning on sneaking out and heading to Moonrise to rescue their 'boss', Mol. The player can offer to go in their place, or encourage them to go (if they go, they die).
session_synopses.Mattis: Dialog with Mattis in Haven. He's a young tiefling boy who dreams of opening up his own shop in baldur's gate. He's delighted to be given the responsibility of the 'shop' in the Last Light Inn and does his best to sound more 'grown-up' and 'formal'. But he fumbles it a bit.This is his main dialogue in Haven and covers all major states, Isobel and Mol kidnapped, the Inn attacked, tieflings dead, etc.
session_synopses.KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD: Umi, Mattis and Ide are discussing a plan to rescue their friend Mol from Moonrise.

AD_LoverInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_LoverInspection.text: We have to worry about parasites now? Gods.

AD_BrotherInspection.speaker: Danis
AD_BrotherInspection.text: I would tell you if I had one, I swear it!

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Manip Vidor
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: J'ehlar is doing her best, but he shows no signs of waking.

AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_ArguingWithFlorrick.text: If you have an alternative in mind, please do propose it.

AD_WulbrenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WulbrenInspection.text: This is ridiculous - as if I'd let some parasite infect me.
AD_WulbrenInspection.context: NodeContext: Loathing in his voice at the thought

FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
FlirtyTiefling.text: The light - it's happening. Ketheric is about to get a long overdue arse-kicking - I can feel it.

AD_SisterInspection.speaker: Lia
AD_SisterInspection.text: Can we hurry this up? I need a drink. Now.
AD_SisterInspection.context: NodeContext: annoyed and a little nervous

FlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Thadwick
FlamingFist_001.text: This is no place for amateurs.
FlamingFist_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: now annoyed that player is talking again

FlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Aubree
FlamingFist_002.text: I've heard the stories about Moonrise. I hope the Duke is all right.
FlamingFist_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: concerned

FlamingFist_003.speaker: Fist Rahir
FlamingFist_003.text: Nothing to be done here. The Duke's in the Towers.
FlamingFist_003.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: strict but coming from a good place

Arrival.speaker: Narrator
Arrival.text: *You drift through the dark until time, skill, or luck brings you to Last Light's dock.*
Arrival.context: CinematicNodeContext: Screen is black. As the narration ends, it fades up to reveal players and prisoners standing on the dock with the Harper walking towards them

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: Hold there! You can't just land and start unloading strangers - there are procedures, damn it.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: No one gets in without being tested - Commander Jaheira's orders.

Arrival.speaker: Player
Arrival.text: Jaheira ordered all Harpers to let me come and go as needed.

Arrival.speaker: Harper Arthus
Arrival.text: The commander cleared you, not your friends.

AD_Gnome02Inspection.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02Inspection.text: I want to go inside - to the wood and stone. Where it's quiet - safe.

FlamingFist_004.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
FlamingFist_004.text: A hundred years locked away inside a curse - can you imagine?
FlamingFist_004.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

FlamingFist_006.speaker: Fist Cyril
FlamingFist_006.text: I'd offer to help, but with Duke Ravengard missing, we can't spare anyone. I'm sorry.
FlamingFist_006.context: CinematicNodeContext: <GL> reshoot, last version had almost no movementInternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.NodeContext: sincere and emotive - you care deeply and are worried for the player's loved ones

AD_FlamingFist_001_CouncillorDefeated.speaker: Fist Thadwick
AD_FlamingFist_001_CouncillorDefeated.text: The Cousellor's fallen - Fists, don't give up!

AD_Inspection.speaker: Harper Arthus
AD_Inspection.text: That's it, this won't take long.

ArrivalInspector.speaker: Harper Arthus
ArrivalInspector.text: Keep your distance. Let's not confuse the parasite.

AD_FlamingFist_005_InCombat.speaker: Fist Gretta
AD_FlamingFist_005_InCombat.text: The Flaming Fist bow to no one.
AD_FlamingFist_005_InCombat.context: NodeContext: in combat - fearless and determined

session_synopses.AD_LoverInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.AD_ArguingWithFlorrick: Florrick and Vidor are talking between themselves about how to proceed. Florrick wants to wait until Mart Cullagh is awake and can tell them more about the shadowcurse. Vidor wants to plan an attack on Moonrise Towers to rescue Grand Duke Ravengard. They aren't at cross purposes, but they don't agree on much.
session_synopses.AD_WulbrenInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlirtyTiefling: Lakrissa's dialogue after her reunion scene with alfira (or potentially this is her only scene if alfira is dead). Lakrissa is usually playful and flirty but she is a but more restrained here. Still smiling but more somber.
session_synopses.AD_SisterInspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_001: Thadwick is a male dwarf and grumpy is his middle name. He's a bit rough and gruff and has little time for the player - an amateur in his eyes. He warms up to him slightly as we progress through the dialogue. This dialogue cover his major states in Haven.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_002: Flaming Fist Aubree is devoted to the Ravengard but also pragmatic. She's unafraid of asking for the player's help and is concerned for Ravengard. Does her best to look at things in a non-judgemental way.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_003: Flaming Fist Rahir is a stern solider who admires Duke Ravengard. He is tough and nonense.
session_synopses.Arrival: Standing on a dock, the Player's just arrived back in Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers with a boat of prisoners seeking sanctuary. A surprised Harper greets you and says he'll need to test the new arrivals.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome02Inspection: Character is under inspection after arriving to HAV from MOO. They need to be checked for a tadpole.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_004: A mercenary with the Flaming Fist, stuck in Haven with the refugees and one too pleased about it.
session_synopses.FlamingFist_006: Flaming Fist Cyril is an elf who feels things deeply. An emotive person, he is positive and tries to see the good in everything.  This dialogue contains several states, including resting, on high alert against ghouls, under attack etc..
session_synopses.AD_Inspection: ADs before and after the Harper at the docks inspects the gnomes/tieflings rescued from Moonrise jail. He's affable, but a little wary.
session_synopses.ArrivalInspector: The Harper Inspecter is either looking over a batch of prisoners who've just arrived in Moonrise or has just finished inspecting them and is walking away when the player intercepts him. A gruff and suspicious guard.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Still rattled by what happened at the Emerald Grove, they'll need time to recover before they'll be ready to talk.*

session_synopses: Triggers if Halsin tries to talk to any of the Tiefling refugees in Haven

node_data.text: *Hiss!*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Here, kitty kitty.
True

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches down on haunches and holds out hand in a 'here kitty kitty' way

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *Rrreow...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cat doesn't approach, but meows in a non-threatening (though still wary) way

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: BOO!

node_data.speaker: His Majesty
node_data.text: *RIIIIIIIIAAOW!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cat lunges out and swipes at the player's foot. Player steps back, but isn't hurt.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Chk. Why would anyone keep such neurotic creatures as pets?

session_synopses: Cat is hanging around Barcus' workshop. Cat is not very friendly and player won't really be able to change the cat into being friendly, only temporarily not-aggro. If the player intimidates the cat, they can convince the cat to leave into the shadowcurse. Might do followup in future but none planned now. If placated, cat will tell player not to trust Isobel.

AD_OutsideSignPost.speaker: Narrator
AD_OutsideSignPost.text: *For a warm bed and full stomach, look no further. Welcome to the Last Light Inn.*
AD_OutsideSignPost.context: NodeContext: a sign for an inn

session_synopses.AD_OutsideSignPost: This signpost is located just outside of the last ligh inn.

session_synopses.AD_WithNightsong: Isobel and Nightsong are reunited at the Last Light. This is after their reunion scene, when they are in Isobel's quarters.

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: It's those damn shadows. Be ready!
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation. [Astarion - realises the shadows are attacking]

ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.speaker: Player
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.text: No hesitation - these people are long dead.
ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat.context: NodeContext: start of combat - high tension situation.

session_synopses.ShadowSiege_PlayerEntersCombat: SCL Haven: Isobel is kidnapped/killed and shadows engulf the inn, combat starts against the shadows. Players find themselves in the middle of it protecting the inn or just because they haven't escaped.

AD_AngryBrother.speaker: Cal
AD_AngryBrother.text: Rolan's right - I should have done more, I should have saved you.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: I can't find Cal and Lia. Tell me they're here... tell me you brought them back.
Rolan.context: NodeContext: Frantic - holding back tears and anger

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: I saved as many as I could, but they didn't make it. I'm sorry.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: How did you decide which ones to save, and which to leave behind?

Rolan.speaker: Player
Rolan.text: I wanted to save everyone, but couldn't.

Rolan.speaker: Rolan
Rolan.text: That's the same mistake I made when they were taken. It's not a mistake I'll make again.

Hologram.text: Lia, Cal, if you see this... I'm dead. It's nothing to get upset about - it's simply the way life is.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Hologram.text: Head to Baldur's Gate immediately. You'll both do excellently there, I have no doubt. And thank you for, well, you know.
Hologram.context: NodeContext: voice thick with emotion at the thought of never seeing his siblings again, but he's trying to be no nonsense. Doesn't want them to grieve.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: If this is about Rolan, go away.
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away from player, avoiding eye contactNodeContext: Upset frustrated

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: No need to snap at me.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: ...Sorry. Rolan snapped too and I didn't like it.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Rolan isn't very good with kids.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: He isn't very good with anyone. He yelled at me just because I told him not to drink anymore.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It was for his own good! He can barely stand up straight.
Ide.context: NodeContext: your voice could be mistake for petulance but you're just hurt and frustrated.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: I get it - you were trying to look after him.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Yeah. He did save us, after all.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Kind of awkward and bashful about it

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Anyway, it's his loss.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: What do you mean, his loss?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I found this book. Old, dusty, full of strange lettering. Pretty sure it's magic.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I was gonna give it to Rolan so he could learn new spells, you know? Beats drinking 'til he forgets the ones he knows.
Ide.context: NodeContext: a little downcast - you were trying to make a gesture and you feel it's been trodden on

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: Can I have it?

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: It's for Rolan.

Ide.speaker: Player
Ide.text: If you give it to me, I'll make sure he gets it.
True

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Fine. Here, you ... huh, where is it?
Ide.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaching behind back for the book to find it missing. Looking around - confused. NodeContext: You can't find the book on your person. You're looking around confused.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: I musta dropped it. Well, you can look for it if you want.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Nonchalant - it's not your problem.

Ide.speaker: Ide
Ide.text: Anyway, I'm sick of talking. You can go now. Bye-bye.
Ide.context: NodeContext: Shrug and nonchalant as you end the convo

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Gods, you smell like a brewery.

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: What does that have to do with anything?
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: pissed off, doesn't like anyone being worried about him

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Lia
AD_BeforeReunion.text: You're enough of an arse when you're sober, never mind drunk.
AD_BeforeReunion.context: NodeContext: knows she's adding fuel to the fire but is too mad not to

AD_BeforeReunion.speaker: Rolan
AD_BeforeReunion.text: Oh, don't get all high and mighty with me, Lia.

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: How am I going to tell him about Lia?
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grieving, wondering how rolan will react

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'We escaped Moonrise, but things went wrong?'
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: trying to practice what to say to rolan, awkward and hesitant

AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.speaker: Cal
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.text: 'Lia didn't make it...' Gods, it doesn't sound real.
AD_BrotherWaitingAlone.context: NodeContext: grief that his sister is dead hitting him

Umi.speaker: Umi
Umi.text: The sky looks so pretty with the light. Whoever it is must be good - they must be.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: When you told me about Rolan, I didn't believe you. But it's true...
Brother.context: NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.context: NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Brother.speaker: Player
Brother.text: He died as he lived - stupidly.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Rolan could be stubborn, but he was never malicious. Not like you.
Brother.context: NodeContext: despite his grief he feels pity for the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Everyone I've ever loved is dead. I have nothing.
Brother.context: NodeContext: shellshocked, unable to process what's happened

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.context: NodeContext: he's planning to walk into the cursed darkness to die - alone

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: exuberant - just returned from a dark place to find your brother Cal, having thought he was lost

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Cal
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: calls out when sees b rother across the room

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: cheeky smile, looking around for sister

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReturns.text: Cal - answer me. Where is Lia?
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: sees brother's face and fears the worst. Accusatory in worry

AD_RolanReturns.speaker: Cal
AD_RolanReturns.context: NodeContext: upset, trying not to cry

session_synopses.AD_AngryBrother: Lia died in Moonrise. Upon his return to Last Light, Cal and Rolan had a massive argument that the player failed to dispel. Cal, upset, walked away from Rolan and now stands on the balcony. He's upset, grieving, and wishing he had died instead of his sister.
session_synopses.Rolan: Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
session_synopses.Hologram: Rolan has left a message behind in Haven, for his siblings. This is a small automated hologram that is fixed to the bar counter. It plays a message (that he's gone looking for his siblings or that he's dead) when the player interacts with it.
