session_synopses.Ide: Ide mainly talks about the interaction the player can have with Rolan in his dialog (HAV_ProdigyLament_Rolan), where he berates the kid for not giving him more alcohol. This dialog continues that narrative beat, and players can acquire a book Ide was planning to give Rolan.
session_synopses.AD_BeforeReunion: This AD covers the following scenarios: Lia alive, Cal dead. Cal alive, Lia dead. Cal, Lia and Rolan all alive and well. This AD occurs after the player has rescued Cal and/ or Lia from Moonrise towers, but BEFORE the player triggers the reunion scene in Last Light. The siblings are standing together and arguing.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherWaitingAlone: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise towers prison by the player and is now in Last Light Inn. His sister Lia is dead and his brother Rolan is nowhere to be found (but he left a message telling Cal to wait for his return). Cal is talking to himself here. He's nervous, scared for Rolan and grieving Lia.
session_synopses.Umi: Umi is young boy in the Haven. He spends most of his time hunting for valuable items in the Inn. He really looks up to the boss of his crew, Mol. This dialogue covers all his main states in Haven, including isobel and mol's kidnapping, when haven is left unprotected, when it's being attacked etc.
session_synopses.Brother: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise Towers by the player and is now in Last Light. This dialogue covers multiple states: Rolan is missing, Rolan is dead, Rolan and Cal had a fight (player must pass a persuade to calm the fight, pass and fail states here), and a general state for when cal, lia and rolan are all alive and well and cal is grateful to the player.
session_synopses.AD_RolanReturns: A one off AD that triggers when the siblings return and spot each other in haven. In this version cal and/or lia are waiting in Last light when rolan returns.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: You're all right. My gods, you're all right!
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex facing each other

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danis and Bex embrace completely. They are so fckn happy to be reunited after Danis was taken to MOO. They end their hug and gaze into each others' eyes at the end of the node

Reunited.speaker: Player
Reunited.text: A beautiful sight, and all thanks to me.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.text: Credit where it's due - Bex, this is the one who helped me and the others escape.
Reunited.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Credit where it's due" turns to player
"Bex' - Danis places hand on Bex's shoulder and looks at her
"This is the one who helped me" alternates between player and Bex to make introductionsNodeContext: With a chuckle, super happy and amused by the player even though player's being a prick

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.text: This isn't the first time you've helped us - saved our lives, really. Why?
Reunited.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bex breaks away and steps toward player, looks at them closely.

Reunited.speaker: Bex
Reunited.context: NodeContext: With a smile, accepting the player's remote reason for helping them. She's sincere and grateful.

Reunited.speaker: Danis
Reunited.text: Thanks aren't enough, but we'll give them anyway. Every day, for the rest of our very long lives.
Reunited.context: NodeContext: With a twinkle in his eye. He's grateful to the player.

AD_StartLoverPromenade.speaker: Bex
AD_StartLoverPromenade.text: So... shall we go for a walk?

AD_StartLoverPromenade.speaker: Danis
AD_StartLoverPromenade.text: Anywhere, my love - I go where you go.

AD_Promenade.speaker: Bex
AD_Promenade.text: This place isn't much, but it's home now I'm here with you.
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Almost apologetic for the run-down place they're staying, but great, warm gladness that Danis is here with her now

AD_Promenade.speaker: Bex
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Sounds like she might be welling up to cry again

AD_Promenade.speaker: Danis
AD_Promenade.text: Please don't start crying again - then I'll cry.
AD_Promenade.context: NodeContext: Comforting (and genuinely worried he might also start crying)

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: Bex isn't easily offended, so gods know what you said to upset her so much.
Danis.context: NodeContext: If the player really offended Bex earlier, Danis reacts. He's still grateful to the player, but wary now.

Danis.speaker: Danis
Danis.text: After everything you've done for us, she'll come around eventually, I'm sure.

session_synopses.Reunited: Danis and Bex are reunited in the Last Light Inn after the player has saved Danis from being trapped in MOO. The two are ecstatic to see one another for the first time in a long time and very grateful to the player.
session_synopses.AD_StartLoverPromenade: Bex and Danis just before setting off for a walk around Haven after being reunited.
session_synopses.AD_Promenade: Bex and Danis walk around Haven taking in the sights after having been reuinited.
session_synopses.Danis: Danis' dialog in Haven after his rescue.He has made it safely to Haven after escaping Moonrise Towers and has been reunited with Bex, his partner, if she's alive, or is alone if she's not. If she's alive, the player witnessed a really cute reunion between them, and these dialogues cover Danis' followups to that conversation, as well as versions for if he's alone and for a few states in Haven. Not all states are covered since Danis doesn't care much about Ketheric

PAD_SpottedWrit.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedWrit.text: What's that sticking out of his pocket?

AD_CursedFistSinging.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_CursedFistSinging.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me are
Climb, climb, climbing up a tree and
AD_CursedFistSinging.context: NodeContext: gently singing this song while sleeping

AD_CursedFistSinging.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_CursedFistSinging.text:
We, we see what we see and
Do just what we please, together,
Waiting for the sun, forever.
AD_CursedFistSinging.context: NodeContext: gently singing this song while sleeping

AD_CursedFistSinging.speaker: Art Cullagh
AD_CursedFistSinging.text:
We see shadows, they get darker,
But our hiding place is brighter.
AD_CursedFistSinging.context: NodeContext: gently singing this song while sleeping

PAD_Writ.speaker: Player
PAD_Writ.text: So he was at the House of Healing? Wonder what he found.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedWrit: Observation on spotting the writ in Art Cullagh's pants. This is needed to direct the player to the House of Healing, which is where they will find his lute.
session_synopses.AD_CursedFistSinging: Art Cullagh is unconscious after being pulled out of the shadowfell. He is in a deep slumber and quietly sings this to himself. Eerie and breathy.
session_synopses.PAD_Writ: Comment on the writ found on Art's body, which mentions the House of Healing.

StuffedBear.speaker: Player
StuffedBear.text: Is that Darkmaw the Wicked? I don't believe it.
StuffedBear.context: InternalNodeContext: Nature skill check succeeded.NodeContext: looking at a stuffed bear statue, it's huge. You recognise it.

StuffedBear.speaker: Player
StuffedBear.text: His territory ran from the Wood of Sharp Teeth to Cloakwood. It took half an army to drive him out. How did he end up here?
StuffedBear.context: NodeContext: looking at a stuffed bear statue, it's huge

session_synopses.StuffedBear: This is Darkmaw the Wicked. He is a huge stuffed bear right by the entrance to Last Light. If the player passes a nature check, they recall the story of Darkmaw, and wonder how he ended up in a tavern, of all places.

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_001.text: General Ketheric wants her alive - at any cost!

AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_FlamingSpy_IsobelCombat_002.text: The General will be pleased if you go quietly.

AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_000.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Jaheira_SiegeCombat_000.text: This fight is winnable. Do not stop!

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.text: This game's awful. Why's anyone play it?
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Raphael
Lanceboard_AD.text: It hones a strategic mind, my dear. Take your turn.

Lanceboard_AD.speaker: Mol
Lanceboard_AD.context: NodeContext: pretending to be bad at the game (she's actually amazing at it)

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: It's good to see you again. I'd ask if you've made any progress with your little problem, but the tell-tale twitching of your eye is answer enough.
Raphael.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

Raphael.speaker: Player
Raphael.text: You again - I'm sure your arrival is simply a coincidence.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: My dear, nothing is coincidence. Mortals trifle themselves with free will, as if their betters have not moulded every potential path ahead.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: No offence meant, of course. I'm sure everyone in Last Light thinks they could have changed things.
CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.
Raphael.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: They're not the only ones ripe for temptation, you know. My last contract here fed me for decades.

Raphael.speaker: Raphael
Raphael.text: Family troubles. Not my family, of course.

AD_NoticedStolenBoard.speaker: Mol
AD_NoticedStolenBoard.text: Huh. Just put this away a second ago... didn't I?

session_synopses.Lanceboard_AD: ADs for Mol and Raphael as they play lanceboard. Mol is pretending to be unskilled and disinterested in the game.
session_synopses.Raphael: If Mol is dead or not present for other reasons, this solo dialogue for Raphael will take place instead.Rather than sitting at the lanceboard table, he is looming in the corner observing everyone else in Last Light.
session_synopses.AD_NoticedStolenBoard: Mol reacts to the player having stolen and put the lanceboard elsewhere.

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Harper Callie
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: But what does Marcus want? What's his target?

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Jaheira
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: Haven't you noticed how close an eye he keeps on Isobel? Think about it: no Isobel, no Last Light.

AD_DiscussingMarcus.speaker: Harper Callie
AD_DiscussingMarcus.text: Isobel... of course! We have to apprehend him now, before he can strike.

OutOfPosition.speaker: Jaheira
OutOfPosition.text: Bear with me for a moment, there are better places to talk.

AD_Attention.speaker: Jaheira
AD_Attention.text: Don't wander far - we need to talk.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: The Archdruid Halsin. Do not be surprised that I know your name - you fit a rather singular description.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: And one survivor of the shadow curse's fall ought to know another.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Player
MeetsHalsin.text: No one who witnessed that battle is likely to forget it.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Not the battle, nor what came after.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: Those of us who saw the birth of the shadow curse seem doomed to return, and bear witness to its work again.

MeetsHalsin.speaker: Jaheira
MeetsHalsin.text: But I ought to warn you, Halsin. Much as it shames me - it is not the curse I come to cleanse, but the cult.

AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.speaker: Jaheira
AD_PlayersAttackJaheira.text: Harpers, to me! We have a True Soul to crush.

session_synopses.AD_DiscussingMarcus: Jaheira discusses the outing of Marcus as a traitor with another Harper. Marcus is unaware he's been exposed at this stage so they discuss sotto voce.
session_synopses.AD_Attention: Jaheira draws the player's attention by calling to them.
session_synopses.MeetsHalsin: Halsin and Jaheira conversation to catch them not being a true soul like she's looking for. Instead they have a civil conversation, but bearly do more than scratch the surface
session_synopses.AD_PlayersAttackJaheira: Jaheira calls all of the Harpers in the Haven to fight if you choose to attack them as part of the Entering Haven situation

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SeluneShrine.context: NodeContext: Arc - SH is loyal to shar

PAD_SeluneShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluneShrine.text: Perhaps they had no choice but to hide.

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you - [prn. Mean-lock]

PAD_MeenlockReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_MeenlockReaction.text: Their eyes are made for the dark - fire and light is our friend.
PAD_MeenlockReaction.context: NodeContext: a monster has appeared before you, trying to warn your fellow player

session_synopses.PAD_SeluneShrine: Comment on the Selunite shrine at 35; 0; -694 in Haven.
session_synopses.PAD_MeenlockReaction: This fight occurs in the basement of the last light inn. Meenlocks are clawed fey creatures. If the player passes a check they identify them and their most dangerous aspect, otherwise they simply reccognise  what the meenlocks are and realise they are sensitive to light (light spell or torch for instance). If they fail, they can make note of their sharp claws (for instance.)

DouseTorch.speaker: Narrator
DouseTorch.text: *The denizens of Last Light are fed up with your reckless torch-dousing in the face of the shadow curse.*

session_synopses.DouseTorch: Darkness causes death in SCL. As such, Haven npcs consider dousing torches as a crime. This crime has one warning.

node_data.speaker: Ox
node_data.text: Glad to see you made it. I am, indeed I am.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Glad to see you made it, too.

node_data.speaker: Ox
node_data.text: I remember you from the grove with the druids. I hoped I'd see you again. And now I have.

session_synopses: The player talks to an Ox. This is the same creature as S_DEN_Mule_001, Peter Hannah

node_data.text: Heading out without Isobel's blessing? Have you got a death wish?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Far from it - thanks for the reminder.
Hate to see the shadows get you before you've begun. Good luck.

session_synopses: Could be one of a number of Last Light guards who sees you leaving without getting the blessing from Isobel and calls out to you to remind you.

session_synopses.AD_ZrellCombat: Players triggered outcast state in MOO by attacking Ketheric in execution or going to the roof before time.Plays in the first combat Zrell participates when the state is active.

AD_TentacleShaft.speaker: Player
AD_TentacleShaft.text: Something slimy seems to be dripping from the rafters above.

Tentacle.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle.text: *Through a narrow crack in the wall, you hear something shift against stone. The pulse of a crawling, living thing.*

Tentacle.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle.text: *You can't quite catch a glimpse, but you recognise this feeling - the same alien presence you felt on the nautiloid.*

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise.text: Whatever that creature was, its telepathic force was unlike anything I've ever encountered. It must be the source of the Absolute.

session_synopses.AD_TentacleShaft: The player passed a perception check to recognise tendrils of organic matter drooping through a wall. Exploring the rafters above this spot leads to the tentacle scene.
session_synopses.Tentacle: Upon interacting with the tentacle living inside the tower's wall, player is faced with several options to choose from. - Take a sample (can be used in Mig mini quest)- Poke to see how it reacts- Examine it to learn more about it- Tear it down with brute forceDamage being done onto the tentacle will trigger a reaction from the Absolute
session_synopses.DaisyAD_FeignSuprise: The player has just made contact with the tentacle in the wall of Moonrise (the Elder Brain). Daisy reacts.

PAD_Use.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Use.text: *From this seat, Ketheric defied gods and raised an army for the Absolute.*
PAD_Use.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grand shot of Ketheric's hall over the player's shoulder.

PAD_Use.speaker: Player
PAD_Use.text: Don't get used to it. One taste of regal power might have you craving more.

session_synopses.PAD_Use: The player sits on Ketherics throne. They feel powerful, though their companions are not convinced. .

AD_Idling.speaker: Araj Oblodra
AD_Idling.text: Hm. Tremors - like a child at her first illiyitrii.
AD_Idling.context:
NodeContext: ill-ee-IT-ree. A courtly occasion in drow culture.
In this state, Araj is quietly flightly and amused at her own flusteredness.

session_synopses.AD_Idling: The Blood Merchant hums to herself as she tinkers with her potions. After Astarion has bitten her, she gets into a really good mood.

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering all that is at stake...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: Considering how close we are to the conclusion of our efforts...

AD_Execution.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_Execution.text: I ask you again: why am I here?
AD_Execution.context: NodeContext: Bitter vitriol in his voice.

session_synopses.AD_Execution: Ketheric's AD before the execution. Bitter vitriol in his voice.

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | I'm not welcome here, but it's safe for now. Thank you. |

node_data.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
node_data.text: | Once we leave this place, I'll make my way to your camp. |

LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.speaker: Narrator
LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.text: *The cult know you live, but believe you to be a thrall, with your mind erased. Best not be seen here without one of your tadpoled companions.*

LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.speaker: Player
LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.text: Prepare to push onwards into Moonrise, whatever the risk.

Guard01.speaker: Zealot Zira
Guard01.text: I hear we'll be marching west soon. Hope to see you on the front line.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: looking forward to the war that's coming

session_synopses.Guard01: A guard in the Moonrise Tower warehouse. Looking forward to the coming war.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: Curious. I believe you were told to wait.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Player
RoofTransgression.text: I need an audience with you.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: You needed to heed the instructions you were given.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: A soldier who cannot follow orders is of no use to me. Goodbye.

session_synopses.RoofTransgression: Ketheric sees players on roof before anything has taken place. Ketheric is displeased with

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: This Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric's immortality.

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: 'Nightsong' - not exactly a name I'd associate with the Absolute.

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: If we find it, maybe we can turn it against him?

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: If we find it. I doubt he's just left it lying around.

session_synopses.PAD_NightsongInfo: The player has read the book detailing the source of Ketheric's invulnrability found in Balthazar's secret room. It's still not clear what the Nightsong is, but it clearly provides immense power.

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard000.context: NodeContext: Snapping at an underling bothering her

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_WithGuard000.text: The shipments are progressing, Disciple. Though I do not trust the mercenaries. The infidels.

AD_WithGuard000.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard000.text: We do not need to trust them. The Absolute's Design requires many threats - not all of them of the finest fabric.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: I am free to do more for the Absolute, Disciple. Anything.
AD_WithSpy.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Would you cast yourself from the tower-top?

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: Of course. I have the Absolute's wings to catch me.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Off you go, then. I've always wanted to try those ballistas.

session_synopses.AD_WithGuard000: A patrolling guard stops and reports to Z'rell.
session_synopses.AD_WithSpy: Z'rell and Marcus are talking after Marcus has kidnapped Isobel.

AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.text: This chamber is unlike the others here - it does not reek of death.

Guard00.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00.text: Hey, True Soul - what's the word?

Guard00.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00.text: Army's gathered outside. The General giving us marching orders?

Guard00.speaker: Player
Guard00.text: The Absolute's plan will unfold in good time. Have faith.

Guard00.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00.text: I have got faith, True Soul. 'Course I do.

Guard00.speaker: Acolyte Daine
Guard00.text: Just got sores from all the sitting around, too.

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Ugh. There's blood on these cards.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: After noticing some gore on her cards

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Aye. My brother's. Had to deal with him after he struck a True Soul - claimed she was some kind of monster.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mild, barely looking up from his hand

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Had to toss him over that terrace there.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Only the vaguest regret - as if murdering his own brother was an unfortunate duty

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mute shock at what she's just heard

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: God. We belong to just the one now, remember.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: First edge in his voice. Firmly clarifying that he won't brook any blasphemy against his god

session_synopses.Guard00: An Absolute guard on the upper floor. She's bored and eager to fight in the name of his new god - or fight for any reason, really.
session_synopses.AD_ImpatientGuards: Idle banter between two guards of rhe Absolute. One is young and eager for battle, the other is more seasoned and relaxed - but reveals himself to be a fanatic true believer

Jailbreak_AD_SpottedMissingPrisoners.text: Get the Warden - the prisoners have escaped!

session_synopses.Jailbreak_AD_SpottedMissingPrisoners: This fires when a guard notices that the prisoners in Moonrise Towers are missing from their cells.

Guard_003.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: a blessing / saying in their church

Guard_002.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002.text: To the city, True Soul! The waiting's done.
Guard_002.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Quietly fanatic - can't wait to march

Guard_005.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Disgruntled, wants to get on her with work

AD_SazzaPlea.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea.text: I didn't survive mad druids and hungry spiders to die here.

AD_FezzerkPlea.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_FezzerkPlea.text: I don't know nothing about any of this.

session_synopses.AD_MintharaPlea: Minthara is pleading for her life before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.Guard_003: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.Guard_002: Male Drow. Guard and Absolute cultist.
session_synopses.Guard_005: Female Human. Guard and Absolute cultist. Magic user.
session_synopses.AD_SazzaPlea: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.
session_synopses.AD_FezzerkPlea: Goblins are pleading for their lives before Ketheric at the MOO Execution scene.These are played as interjections after Ketheric finishes his own AD.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: General Thorm's prayers and preparations must not be disturbed. The rooftop is off-limits to everyone.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to Radija

node_data.speaker: Radija
node_data.text: Even you, Disciple Z'rell?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Z'rell

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Everyone. Keep watch, and ensure that nobody passes.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to Radija

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Excellent timing, True Soul.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: now addressing player

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: The goblins - tell me how they suffered.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: No. Better yet - show me.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Her mind enters yours abruptly, flickering across your memories in a blaze of excitement.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *She sees the goblins walking free, and a burning rage fans across your mind like wildfire.*

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: Explain yourself.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You said I could do whatever I wanted with them - so I did.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: I didn't expect you to do that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Angry, fiery, disbelief

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: I was hoping you'd be able to help with something more important - but you're only fit to muck out the jail cells.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Good - I'll free the rest of the prisoners while I'm down there.

node_data.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
node_data.text: I'm going to have to teach you some obedience.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Hostile to player, disadvantage to player on first roundNodeContext: Fiery, flirtatious, with a dangerous smirk

session_synopses: Dialogue with Z'rell when she's upstairs. This takes place after the execution scene, and involves Z'rell mind-melding to see how players dealt with the goblins, and testing their 'desire' to be one with the Absolute via a second mind-meld. She then gives them the mission to aid Balthazar, giving them the key to his chamber, and instructing them to find evidence of where he can be found.

PAD_SharranObservation.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharranObservation.text: There is nothing Sharran about this man. He has betrayed the Dark Lady.

Zhent02.speaker: Yerle
Zhent02.text: Ain't looking to convert, True Soul. Gods mind their mess, I mind mine.
Zhent02.context: NodeContext: Respectful but flat refusal - most Absolutists want to convert others, and she's pre-empting it.

AD_BugbearThrow.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow.text: I could hit a pixie from a hundred paces.
AD_BugbearThrow.context: NodeContext: congratulating himself on a well-thrown axe, while practicing

BazaarStander_006.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006.text: The prisoners below are gone, True Soul. I cannot understand why they would flee Her mercy.
BazaarStander_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The prisoners successfully escaped from Moonrise's dungeons (perhaps all, perhaps only one)NodeContext: Confused, hurt - prisoners in the cell escaped - she saw them as heathens her church was trying to 'save'

BazaarStander_007.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007.text: I hear you've been summoned for an audience with Her. You will return changed, I'm sure of it.
BazaarStander_007.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Wishing us well - we're about to get our 'reward'

Guard01.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01.text: You should go through the main hall. Witnessing the General's justice is an honour.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Heard a rumour some do-gooder stopped a horde of Absolutists from getting their hands on a load of druids in some grove.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Whoever it was better pray the General doesn't smoke 'em out. Be a bloodbath, so it would.

Bystander00.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00.text: You're the best True Soul I ever met.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: I saw it, True Soul. The army. They're nearly ready. It's nearly time.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: Us. We are so many. And we are marching to Baldur's Gate, as soon as the Absolute gives word.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: I've never been to battle. I've never been to war. But I feel so... calm. Ready.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening.text: Enough! Just leave the bloody True Souls to their business.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what's to say that couldn't be us? They say the General rewards them as serve him well.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what about them who hang around his door like a bad smell?

AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.speaker: Zealot Brinn
AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.text: Another True Soul. The Disciple will want to see you - through the main doors.

AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry.text: Converts, pilgrims, mercenaries. They all seek power, but will find only death.

Bystander03.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03.text: She sees everything we are, do you understand? There is no hiding from Her!

Bystander02.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02.text: We ought to head out now - burn everything between here and the city.

Bystander04.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04.text: The Disciple has returned upstairs but... perhaps she'll still see me.
Bystander04.context: NodeContext: Wants to go, psyching himself up a bit. Now he has his chance and he's a bit scared

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims.text: Brothers. Sister. Pray with me while we wait.

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims.text: I'm not worthy. I... I never learned the words.

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
AD_Pilgrims.text: Yes, you did. She gives them to you fully formed. Can you hear Her?
AD_Pilgrims.context: NodeContext: gentle and encouraging, sharing a special religious moment with someone (their 'god' is mentally controlling them in the background, giving them words to a prayer)

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims.text: Of many hearts, one soul. Of many thoughts, one mind...
AD_Pilgrims.context: NodeContext: Halting but with increasing joy. He never learned this prayer but realizes his god is  giving him the words

session_synopses.PAD_SharranObservation: Shadowheart notices that Ketheric is no longer a Sharran
session_synopses.Zhent02: A Zhentarim agent guarding Roah Moonglow. She's looking around at the growing power of the church and feeling wary of it.
session_synopses.AD_BugbearThrow: The bugbear vendor in Moonrise spends his time throwing an axe at a target. He is quite full of himself and proud of his strength.
session_synopses.BazaarStander_006: A novice of the church of the Absolute, by turns praying to herself or speaking to us, who she sees as a leading follower of her god
session_synopses.BazaarStander_007: This novice has joined the church in the hopes of being elevated to True Soul. She's not here for personal gain, but seeking an actual religious experience - one she believes we've already been blessed to have.
session_synopses.Guard01: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He love and respects authority, and enjoys the thought of failure being punished.
session_synopses.Bystander01: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. His commentary changes depending on how the player handled the grove.
session_synopses.Bystander00: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander. This one is worried about the other goblins that were sent to the execution room.
session_synopses.Guard00: A guard watching the alarm system on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's brusque to anyone who approaches.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsListening: The Bazaar Goblins are listening into the execution, worried about their own necks.
session_synopses.AD_BazEntranceGuard_002: The guard points the player towards the execution room after they first enter the tower.
session_synopses.Bystander03: A frightened bystander on the ground floor of Moonrise Tower. He's deeply upset by the scrying eyes wandering the tower. He's caught between religious rapture and terror - he dreads and loves the Absolute in equal measure.
session_synopses.Bystander02: A goblin on the floor of Moonrise Towers, chatting absently while being a bystander.
session_synopses.Bystander04: This human is waiting to speak to Z'rell. A big tough guy but is full  of hope that the Absolute will be proud of him. Should have a faint air of a stalker.
session_synopses.AD_Pilgrims: The pilgrms have travelled far to speak with the Absolute, but they are being told to stay in the main entrance. Belub is deciding what to do with them in the mean time.

PAD_TreasureDiscovered.speaker: Player
PAD_TreasureDiscovered.text: This is the spot that's marked on that map.

session_synopses.PAD_TreasureDiscovered: Player passes a spot at the base of MOO that they'd earlier found marked on a map.

Guard2.speaker: Adept Merim
Guard2.text: Plenty of supplies if you're running low, True Soul.

session_synopses.Guard2: Guard who stops you at the entrance to Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.Ghoul1: Trianglehead ghoul at the entrance to Moonrise TowerInclusion will only trigger once on one of the three ghouls (so the inclusion on all three should be the same.)
session_synopses.AD_Ghouls: Two ghouls patrol near the entrance of Moonrise. They have beef with the winged ghouls higher up on the exterior of the tower. They (very roughly) talk about their dislike for the winged chouls.

AD_PrisonComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_PrisonComment.text: Hohohoooo! Conditions most grim, courtesy of Ketheric Thorm.

session_synopses.AD_PrisonComment: The spirit in the amulet comments on the prison in Moonrise Towers

session_synopses.AD_Combat: Combat ADs for the drider when he moves to the top of the tower.

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *Minthara is supposed to be in a cell - you have some explaining to do.*

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Player
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: Minthara's been released - and that frees up a cell for people like you, who challenge their betters.

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *You avoided a fight this time, but bullying your way out of Moonrise is a risky proposition.*

session_synopses.MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara: This dialogues occurs when you are seen close to Minthara once she is freed from Moonrise Towers. It needs to be a GEB dialogue, and thus unvoiced - so Minthara won't speak. Instead, she'll react to the outcome with an AD once the guard has left / died.

Guard01.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
Guard01.text: Don't mind Mig and her 'meat sounds'. It's just her brain slopping around in her skull.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: Mig is an ogre complaining about 'meat sounds' - you are reluctantly sharing a room with the ogre, and explaining his weirdness away

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: You'd find better lodgings out in the war camp, True Soul.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: I know we're all one under the Absolute, but you do not want to bunk with an ogre.
Guard02.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - this guard has seen things

session_synopses.Guard01: A guard stationed alongside Mig the ogre. Mig is complaining of hearing "meat sounds" - in actuality it's a monster moving through the walls. This guard doesn't believe him either way.
session_synopses.Guard02: A guard in the guard room of Moonrise Tower. They're growing accustomed to living and fighting alongside monstrous races.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

AD_FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling.context: NodeContext: leaving without the player, broken hearted and filled with regret

AD_TieflingsFreed.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_TieflingsFreed.context: NodeContext: yelling with authority and confidence

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Few survive Disciple Balthazar's experiments. This is your chance to submit to the Absolute - to find peace.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: this is, in a strange way, the warden trying to be comforting, even if it comes across cruel

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: I am far gentler than Disciple Balthazar. You wish to live? Grow a spine.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: Or, if you're very lucky, perhaps he will split you open and sew in a new one.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: a venemous smile at her cruel words

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and a little frantic

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail.text: There's something evil here. Below, down, down... argh!
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: scared and panicked, noise of pain at 'argh'. Clutches head briefly

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail.text: Unless this 'evil' can get us out of here, I don't want to hear about it.
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: doesn't really give a shit his comrade is scrared - focused on himself and the plan

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Don't talk to us. You're just making it worse.
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: I can't believe Rolan is gone. Gods, just saying it out loud...
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: Let's focus on escaping, all right?

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: We'll give Rolan the send off he deserves - when we're both safe.

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: You're right. Let's... let's talk about something else.
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: heartbroken, but knows lia is right

AD_ToolRefused.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ToolRefused.text: Gaerdal help me - how about a club? A hammer? Hurry!
AD_ToolRefused.context: NodeContext: on the brink of losing his temper, trying to sound authorative but he really just wants to call the player an idiot

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Nadi
Guard_004.text: Don't speak to the prisoners. The Absolute forbids it.

GnomePrisoner_002.speaker: Nickels
GnomePrisoner_002.text: Nimble said to close my eyes. But I can hear it - the stone is screaming.

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: Boat's good to go - all that's left is to ship off.
Boat.context: NodeContext: tense but relieved - they've made it to the boat and are about to flee moonrise

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: My plan, for now, is to hide out on the water. Unless you have a better idea?

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.text: If I were you, I'd stay on the water. But it's your call.

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: True - anywhere is better than here.
Boat.context: NodeContext: worried but trying to be confident

Boat.speaker: Danis
Boat.text: But I can't leave without saying this - something big is going on in Moonrise. I heard whispers of something - an army. Do what you have to here, and then leave. Soon.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: You! You're from the grove. Are you all right?
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: she recognises the player - concerned

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: No kidding. What are you even doing here?
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: trying to be cavalier but actually terrified for herself and her brother

ProdigySister.speaker: Player
ProdigySister.text: Well, I was planning on rescuing you...

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: said with a smile, trying to rassure player

ProdigySister.speaker: Cal
ProdigySister.text: No, this is perfect! You're by the gnomes. They've been whispering like mad for days - they're up to something.
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: excited - most hope they've had for days

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: What in the Nine Hells have you done? Moonrise has lost its damn mind - and we're next on the cutting block.

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: In my defence, it was an accident.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: Furious. "Gaerdal" = GAIR-dul. Gaerdal is a deity, so expressed like "God help me."

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: We need to get out of here or we're stone dead. Get us tools, anything that could crack the wall behind us.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Or find a way to get this damn door open. Hurry!
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: Got it - I'll be back soon.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: trying not to sound to frustrated that the job isn't done - wants player to hurry

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.text: The prisoners have escaped - and the blame falls on me. I will be split open, my innards splayed before the eyes of the Absolute.

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.context: NodeContext: closes eyes briefly and sighs as she accepts her fate

Warden.speaker: Player
Warden.text: I'm glad I snuck the prisoners out when I did.

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.context: NodeContext: an almost hysterical laugh as the player confesses to helping prisoners escape

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.text: The Absolute shines upon me. She tests me - then She gifts me you. I will now rip you apart - in Her name.
Warden.context: NodeContext: zealous, relieved - about to attack player

AD_Gnome01.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01.context: NodeContext: leaving the player behind to die as she hops on the boat and leaves

Guard_002.speaker: Adept Keris
Guard_002.text: Did you request this post too? I'm glad I got the Warden and not Z'rell.

Guard_002.speaker: Adept Keris
Guard_002.text: Don't get chatty with the prisoners, mind you. The Warden won't like that.

AD_TieflingLover.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingLover.text: We don't have time. Get to the boat, or we leave!
AD_TieflingLover.context: NodeContext: calling out to the player, who is in combat. Wants to leave on the boat and now

AD_Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_Wulbren.text: Blasted chains - keep the bastards off me!
AD_Wulbren.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth, trying to break the chains that have tied up the boat. Trying not to panic

AD_WardenChase.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenChase.text: The prisoners are escaping! All arms to me - NOW.
AD_WardenChase.context: NodeContext: Roaring with authority and fury

session_synopses.PAD_ApproachingPrisoners: Quick VB about the prisoners and the fate that awaits them. This is mainly used to draw attention to them as the players explore the prison area.
session_synopses.AD_FlirtyTiefling: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsFreed: Wulbren has just bust down the back wall of a prison to very surprised tieflings, who he barks this out at.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingInspection: Warden has an exchange with the tieflings in Jail.
session_synopses.AD_GnomesInJail: The gnomes are in jail and discussing their predicament. Wulbren is taking charge and nickles and nimble are doing their best to help.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is the brother of Lia and Rolan. He was ambushed along with the other tieflings and taken to Moonrise. His brother Rolan is at Last light inn. He is afraid but trying to be strong for the other tieflings, and is determined to save his sister.
session_synopses.AD_ProdigiesInJail: AD between Cal and Lia in Moonris prison. They are exhausted and being held by murderous cultists of the Absolute.
session_synopses.AD_ToolRefused: Wulbren has asked the player to get 'tools'. Player has to throw the tool to him in the cell. In this instance, player has thrown something to him he can't use.
session_synopses.Guard_004: Nadi doesn't enjoy being a prison guard but considers it her duty. She tries to reassure the player.
session_synopses.GnomePrisoner_002: Nickles is a savant who has an incredible ability to read the earth and stone around him, but is nervous and quite fearful as a person. He is easily frightened. He is imprisoned in moonrise and in the following lines escapes by boat (which he hates)/fights his way out/ and has a general greeting.
session_synopses.Boat: After Wulbren instigates the escape any escaping prisoners try to make it to the boat and flee Moonrise. This dialogue covers the case in which the boat leaves without the player or joins them in the escape.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: This is lia's main dialogue in moonrise towers. She's been taken captive (along with her brother cal) - she doesn't know if her other brother rolan is alive or dead. Lia is brave and used to being in tough situations, but she's terrified for herself anf her brother (and trying to mask it with anger). Her main dialogue occurs with her in a cell and speaking to the player on the other side of the bars. There are additional branches for when she's in one cell and the player was arrested an in the cell next to her.
session_synopses.Wulbren: Wulbren is the leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. He is currently imprisoned in moonrise towers. He has the lazy charm of arrogant and the determination and cunning of the leader of a revolution. In this dialogue he offers you the main quest - to free him and the tieflings from the prison. He can speak to you through the bars - either with the player in prison, OR with the player speaking to them from the outside. NOTE: Wulbren pushes hard to charm the player and make them think they're friends. He keeps the friendly and charming mask on tight (dropping it only when he insults the player). We can have the lightest touch of menace in this dialogue, a hint that he's holding something back or that there is more to this than it seems, but it should be a light touch. He is friendly and charming here (the mask will drop back at Haven when he is rescued).
session_synopses.Warden: The Warden is a devout follower of the Absolute with an iron will, but also a sense of mischief. When the player approaches, she sees it as an opportunity to play with the player a little bit - like a cat with a mouse.
session_synopses.AD_Gnome01: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.Guard_002: Keris is an upbeat and devout follower of the Absolute and admires the Warden.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLover: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.AD_Wulbren: Collection of solo ADs used by character during the Jailbreak escape in Moonrise Towers.
session_synopses.AD_WardenChase: Warden runs out of her post to go after the prisoners.

DaisyAD_Audience.text: There can be no doubt. This is the place. This is where we'll discover the secret of the Absolute.

session_synopses.DaisyAD_Audience: A character has made mention of an Audience with the Absolute, Daisy makes a comment about this.

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *The eye focuses on you, taking in every detail of your appearance.*

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *A spark glows within the heart of the construct - someone, or something, watches you from beyond.*

session_synopses.Eye: A dialogue you can have with any of the scrying eyes that patrol moonrise towers. It was written to give a hint that Gortash/one of his cronies are watching you from beyond.

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *A wave of sick familiarity radiates from one barrel amidst the cargo.*

Vat.speaker: Narrator
Vat.text: *Tadpoles. Sleeping and scarcely aware, but echoing yours a hundredfold.*

AD_Minthara_AtDocks.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_AtDocks.text: Shipments of parasites, bound for Baldur's Gate. Half the city may be infected already.

GuardJumper.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper.text: I'm afraid you missed the ship, True Soul.
GuardJumper.context: NodeContext: Friendly - speaking to an equal (he believes)

GuardJumper.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper.text: But there'll be another along soon enough. We're already stacking the cargo.
GuardJumper.context: CinematicNodeContext: gestures nondescriptly at nearby crates

GuardJumper.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper.text: Baldur's Gate. The army marches overland, but we've sent some friends ahead to smooth the way.

AD_JumperGreeting.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_JumperGreeting.text: Enjoy the view. Feels like it'd stretch all the way to the Sea of Swords on a clear day. If this place ever gets a clear day.

Checkpoint.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint.text: *Her thoughts invade your own, hunting for recognition. Your parasite offers it, readily.*

Checkpoint.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint.text: True Soul. A pleasure. What news from the field?

Checkpoint.speaker: Player
Checkpoint.text: More importantly, why is one of our rank on guard duty?

Checkpoint.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint.text: To greet those of our like, and weed out those who walk where they do not belong.

GuardPatroller000.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000.text: Hold your nose 'round the crates. Some got a little ripe down in the cellar.

AD_ObserverInspect.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverInspect.context: NodeContext: Ill-MAY-ter - a god of martyrdom. The curse is a bit like 'Jesus Christ', with a creative 'arsing' thrown in.

session_synopses.Vat: The player has investigated the vat, showing thousands of tadpoles. They are being used to bolster their number of soldiers for their attack on Baldurs Gate. The player can destroy the Vat, depriving some of their numbers, or utter a phrase to influence whoever these tadpoles end up attached to.
session_synopses.GuardJumper: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock. The crates contain tadpoles, intended to infect the citizens of Baldur's Gate. The guard doesn't know this, and if we force the knowledge on him his mind breaks.
session_synopses.AD_JumperGreeting: Acolyte Marls, who stands guard of the cargo at the docks, greets the player as they first pass by the docks at Moonrise.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).
session_synopses.GuardPatroller000: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.
session_synopses.AD_Patroller000Witness: DockPatroller_000 witness DockJumper jumping into the water.
session_synopses.AD_ObserverInspect: The dock observer has seen that the Vat he was in charge of was destroyed. He articulates this disappointment.

AD_WelcomingMinthara.speaker: Questioner Sumera
AD_WelcomingMinthara.text: Nightwarden Minthara - your dereliction of duty has finally caught up with you.
AD_WelcomingMinthara.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_FailedInterrogation.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_FailedInterrogation.text: Break them, before they call for help.
AD_FailedInterrogation.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

AD_AttackedTorturers.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_AttackedTorturers.text: You dared scar my mind, I will gut you.
AD_AttackedTorturers.context: NodeContext: in combat, either goading her enemies, or on the 'let us free them' line, relishing the fight while speaking to her allies

DrowFollowing.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing.context: NodeContext: Hushed, spike of worry - we're sneaking her out through enemy territory and she's wary of being caught.

DrowFollowing.speaker: Player
DrowFollowing.text: I need you to wait here.

DrowFollowing.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
DrowFollowing.text: We're between the Absolute's teeth and you ask me to sit still?
DrowFollowing.context: NodeContext: Hushed, incredulous - she wants to be free of this place

PAD_HelpMinthara.speaker: Player
PAD_HelpMinthara.text: Minthara was dragged to the prison in Moonrise. If she's still there, this is our last chance to save her.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: Minthara sustains the Absolute's unhealing wound.

Torturer1.speaker: Questioner Sumera
Torturer1.text: There will be more traitors still. They too must suffer - see to it.

session_synopses.AD_WelcomingMinthara: Minthara has arrived to the torturers room. They are delighted and welcome her before they get to torture her.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: The player is accompanied by Minthara and is stopped by the entrance guards. They do not think Minthara should be allowed to leave.
session_synopses.AD_FailedInterrogation: On Minthara's turn, in combat after failing to pass by an interrogating guard.
session_synopses.AD_AttackedTorturers: On Minthara's turn, when attacking the torturers.
session_synopses.DrowFollowing: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two drow guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
session_synopses.PAD_HelpMinthara: When party exits Moonrise after Execution scene, if player have not started helping Minthara in any way we play this PAD to remind about her.
session_synopses.Torturer1: Sumera loves her job and any excuse to cause a little pain. One-liner after torturing Minthara.

AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.text: Security is tight here. Z'rell made this library her command post.

PAD_ColonyComment.speaker: Player
PAD_ColonyComment.text: Look - there's something on the other side. No way through from here though.

session_synopses.PAD_HorrorScreech: A PAD reacting to an audible screech from a hook horror in the Oubliette. The screech plays and the player character reacts to hearing it. If they have encountered Hook Horrors before in the Underdark, they will react differently.
session_synopses.PAD_ColonyComment: Party reacts to seeing the Colony through the blood aquarium window that separates the Oubliette from the Colony Morgue. The intention here is to strongly imply that we cannot get into the Colony from the Oubliette.
session_synopses.CorpseMembranes_Dead: The Speak With Dead dialog for the corpse hidden behind the mind flayer membranes in the bloodbath section of the Oubliette. This corpse is currently a goblin, but its race and backstory can be changed at the writer's behest.

AD_Bark.speaker: Squire
AD_Bark.context: NodeContext: Calling guards down on us

session_synopses.AD_Bark: The player entered combat with Ketheric's Hound on the upper floor of Moonrise (most likely within Ketheric's room). The hound barks to call one of the scrying eyes over to their location.

AD_ZrellWaiting.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellWaiting.text: If so much as a rat crosses that bridge, cut its throat.

session_synopses.AD_ZrellWaiting: The player has killed Nightsong, making Ketheric vulnrable and causing him to retreat to the top of Moonrise. Z'rell wait's outside the entreance of Moonrise for the predicted arrival of the player (or whoever would have caused this terrible crime).

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_OnBreak.text: Bah. Why we all still waiting around, anyway? City ain't gonna sack itself.
AD_OnBreak.context: NodeContext: Grunting in frustration, eager to get to battle

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_OnBreak.text: General's a great thinker, I hear. I suppose he's strategising.

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_OnBreak.text: War-chiefs don't plan. Either our god is stronger than all the others, or She ain't.

AD_OnBreak.speaker: Warrior Gronag
AD_OnBreak.text: What, you gonna defect? Follow Sune of the Pretty Face?
AD_OnBreak.context: NodeContext: Mocking (Sune = SOO-nee, goddess of beauty)

session_synopses.AD_OnBreak: |Goblins are on a break after escorting the drider caravan. They are now enjoying

DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated.text: It won't work - not until we find out what is keeping him from death!

session_synopses.DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated: If player inflicts combat with immortal Ketheric Daisy urges to fallback and solve the problem of invulnerability first

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: These are the stalking grounds of Steelclaw, furless one - tread lightly.
node_data.context: NodeContext: low threatening tone

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: Fortunately for you, the slithering vermin I hunt has my attention - for now.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous, hinting that she'd turn on the player in an instant

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The parasites are dangerous, don't go near them.

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: Do not push your own cowardice upon me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: disgusted with the player. She is a hunter, she will kill only the most deadly of prey

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: I braved lapping waters and leaking ships to find this prey. I butchered many, and will butcher many more.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous but starting to get a little excited at the mention of the butchering

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: But this one - this one I toy with. I slice, I tear, and when the time is right, I will bite its head off and bathe in its innards.
node_data.context: NodeContext: going full on murderous psychopath as her excitement builds, peaking in the last line.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You know that tadpole is dead, right?

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: Lies, it merely pretends. But I am a patient hunter - I will wait for it to stir, and then I will strike.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous

node_data.speaker: Steelclaw
node_data.text: Now, I must return to my prey. It  has been too long since it felt the bite of fear.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous

session_synopses: As the player explore the surrounding of Moonrise, they can encounter a cat playing with a dead tadpole. Upon interacting with this cat, player can learn where the tadpoles are actually being stored at (SWA) or the location of a nearby tunnel they can use in cat form (Non-SWA). Steelclaw is a murdering psychopath who revels in blood and gore.

AD_GuardJumper.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_GuardJumper.text: Can't believe you'd betray the Absolute. Idiot.

AD_AccessCultistCombat.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistCombat.text: You'll die before you reach my lord. Perhaps then you will be obedient.
AD_AccessCultistCombat.context: NodeContext: Grim, angry. Promising to kill us and resurrect us as a more obedient slave.

AD_JaheiraSolo.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo.text: Here we stand in the lion's den, but the lions are you and I.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.text: It's a grim task, picking provisions from the dead.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.text: But the way I hear it, the fighting's not done yet. You need to resupply?

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster.context: NodeContext: Blessing - as absent as saying 'god bless', not overly pious

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.text: You fight as well as any Harper. Careful, or Jaheira might have to keep you.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger.context: NodeContext: Wry, a little breathless. Lull in battle.

Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup.text: It's all up to you now. Ketheric awaits.

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: You dare show yourself here, after all you've done?
Executioner.context: NodeContext: impressed to have seen a legendary hero (Jaheira) up close and personal - really wants to kill said hero

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: You have betrayed me, you have betrayed General Thorm - you have betrayed our god!
Executioner.context: NodeContext: building fury, peaking on final phrase

Executioner.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner.text: And for what? That little firefly buzzing around overhead? I'll crush you first, then her - and in death, you will all serve the Absolute.

CrestfallenHound_SwA.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA.text: That scent - the Selûnite magic on your skin - it fills this place.

CrestfallenHound_SwA.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA.text: It fills my head with things I miss. I cannot remember them, but I do miss them.
CrestfallenHound_SwA.context: NodeContext: Sadly - thinking of a past life, barely remembered

AssaultHarper_001.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001.text: Onwards. Ketheric can't hide from us now!
AssaultHarper_001.context: NodeContext: A lull in battle - fervent, caught up in the moment

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.speaker: Harper Lymn
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.text: The false god creeps. The city must wake.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that we need to get to the city.

AssaultFlamingFist_001.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001.text: Watching gods. These poor bastards actually die believing.
AssaultFlamingFist_001.context: NodeContext: Vague disbelief, regret - they're killing people who believe in a nonsense god.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder.text: That was rather rude, wasn't it? To assume I am content to be killed by one of low breeding.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder.text: I want you to go away, and think about what you did.

AssaultFlamingFist_002.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002.text: Come on. Plenty more to do yet.
AssaultFlamingFist_002.context: NodeContext: Heat of battle, focused and not really interested in conversation.

AssaultHarper_003.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003.text: This place... stinks of blood and fear. That is all the Absolute offers.
AssaultHarper_003.context: NodeContext: Disgust and scorn for the Absolute.

PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric.text: Ketheric Thorm is waiting for us. Are we ready?

DaisyAD_FollowKetheric.text: That tentacle was colossal. The same creature we encountered before. We must follow where it went.

Jaheira_Following.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following.text: Our host is at the top of the tower. Rude to keep him waiting, no?

Jaheira_Following.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following.text: It is I who follows you. But, if I must venture some advice... this is the simple part. Ketheric dies, or we do. And the Sword Coast with us.

AssaultHarper_002.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002.text: This place is all dark corners. Stay sharp, eh?
AssaultHarper_002.context: NodeContext: Tense, in the heart of the enemy's tower.

JaheiraThroneRoomOrders.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraThroneRoomOrders.text: Patrol this floor, Harpers. Watch the doors and watch the windows. Nothing enters or exits these rooms alive.

AD_PrisonWarden.speaker: The Warden
AD_PrisonWarden.text: I'll smear your entrails on these walls. In Her name!

AD_GuardObserver.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_GuardObserver.text: Come at me - come on, then!
AD_GuardObserver.context: InternalNodeContext: intentionally weirdNodeContext: high on the possibility of battle

AssaultFlamingFist_004.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004.text: We'll hold this point. Give Ketheric our regards, aye?
AssaultFlamingFist_004.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - they've fought all the way up the tower, and now it's up to us

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger.text: We're pushing them back. The Moonmaiden's with us.

PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning.text: The battle won't be won down here.

AssaultHarper_004.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004.text: Gods above, the tadpoles. I think I saw one crawl out of a corpse.
AssaultHarper_004.context: NodeContext: Hint of nausea - very much a rookie

BossFightIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
BossFightIntro.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Ketheric; he is shivering; anxious; manic with the reality that he has been made vulnerable.

Ketheric jerkily turns toward the player with hatred in his eyes.InternalNodeContext: INTRO: Before initial fight

BossFightIntro.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
BossFightIntro.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Ketheric; he is shivering; anxious; manic with the reality that he has been made vulnerable.

Tremors shake the tower now and then, evidence of Nightsong's assault.
Ketheric jerkily turns toward the player with hatred in his eyes.InternalNodeContext: INTRO: Before initial fight

session_synopses.AD_GuardJumper: During the assault on Moonrise. If the player "fixed" the dock jumpers mind, his combat AD will be a bit garbled.
session_synopses.AD_AccessCultistCombat: She is the last line of defence to the roof of the tower during the assault on Moonrise. She yells this on her turn during combat.
session_synopses.AD_JaheiraSolo: Jaheira is outside Moonrise Towers, talking to herself contemplating her next steps to assault the tower (if Florrick is available, a different AD plays). Once the main floor has been cleared of enemies, she makes comments about the tower and the assault.(Triggers regardless of if Florrick is present).
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster: If Florrick is present during the assault, the Harper Quartermaster will be present as well to provide trade to the player. They are not invloved in the combat, but will move into the tower once things are cleared.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger: Naysa is one of the Harpers who fights beside you at Moonrise.
session_synopses.Executioner: Zrell 'greets' the player inside the Tower along with the rest of the Monnrise offencive force during the assault on Moonrise. Nightsong might be alive or dead.This is a stand-off - she's protecting the tower, and the players are attacking. Z'rell is confident that she'll put the players and their allies down here, and shows no fear.
session_synopses.CrestfallenHound_SwA: If Ketherics Hound smelled Isobel's blessing on the player, she will move into Isobels room and not participate in the combat ongoing throughout the tower, as she is lost in vague feelings and hazy memories of a life past.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_001: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger: Lymn is one of the Harpers who fights with us at Moonrise.She speaks in a unique cadence because Common is her Seventh language. She is focused on feelings and impressions.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_001: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.DarkUrgeButlerReminder: The player has never spoken to Isobel before starting the assault on Moonrise. The Butler appears in front of the player on the bridge to Moonrise to remind the Dark Urge player that they must kill Isobel if they want to please Bhaal.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_002: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_003: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric: Players won the fight near the door that leads to the roof for the showdown with Ketheric. With this PAD we both confirm that and pre-warn player that the next fight is tough and better to restock
session_synopses.DaisyAD_FollowKetheric: Top of the tower, after fight with Ketheric and seeing the giant tentacle.
session_synopses.Jaheira_Following: Jaheira's follower dialogue for Moonrise when she's actively accompanying the player.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_002: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.JaheiraThroneRoomOrders: Jaheira has arrived inside the Moonrise Towers throne room after clearing the out all the enemies. If there are any Harpers alive, Jaheira will give them orders to patrol around the tower.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_003: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.AD_PrisonWarden: Combat AD when the player is assaulting Moonrise tower. The prison warden has is defending the throne room.
session_synopses.AD_GuardObserver: Played at the start of combat at the player if they went to the docks during the assault on Moonrise.
session_synopses.AssaultFlamingFist_004: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.AD_ZrellCallout: Z'rell is waiting inside the main hall of Moonrise towers. She taunts the player/harpers/flaming fist as they wait outside the main entrance. This is her last stand, and she is not happy about it.
session_synopses.AD_BarnabusCombat: A combat AD that plays on Barnabus' turn during the Moonrise Assault. If the player freed them, they are allied with them and will call back to that. Otherwise, he will do a generic combat AD.
session_synopses.AD_WardenWaiting: The Warden is not pleased about the current situation and is not afraid to express it. She waits in the throne room as rienforcement if the battle with Z'rell's group starts to go sour.
session_synopses.HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger: Antony is a Harper who fights with us at Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning: The player has entered the Moonrise prison during the assault (with some warning against in most cases). This is a final heads up to the player that the skeletons they are fighting will just keep respawning with no reward, so it is best to leave asap.
session_synopses.AssaultHarper_004: A soldier fighting alongside us during Assault on Moonrise. Lines for before, during, and after the battle.
session_synopses.BossFightIntro: When you arrive on the rooftop after making Ketheric vulnerable, he will be shivering and furious at the fact that his invulnerability has been taken from him. The Tower is under attack and he's in a desperate state. He will fight the player, unless by a huge stroke of luck the player convinces him to surrender. Edge-case path: Audience with the Absolute (captured Nightsong then messed up Z'rell)
session_synopses.AD_ZrellCombat: The player has entered combat with Z'rell during the assault on Moonrise (freed Nightsong).

session_synopses.DeadHarper: The player uses Speak with Dead to talk to a dead Harper in the Shadowcursed Lands. The Harper was sent by Jaheira to find weaknesses in Ketheric's Defense. The Harper player should be able to earn some redundant information that can be learned elsewhere as well as some unique information to help them navigate Act 2

VB_Debilitated.speaker: Player
VB_Debilitated.text: This place... I feel chilled to the marrow.

PAD_InvestigatedOx.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedOx.text: Hells. Poor thing didn't deserve to die like this.
PAD_InvestigatedOx.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a dead ox at the site of an ambushed refugee caravan

PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.text: Gored to death, by the look of it.
PAD_InvestigatedTiefling.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a tiefling who was gored to death

session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedOx: Player discovers the dead ox that was part of the tiefling refugee caravan. The ox became shadowcursed before being killed by the tieflings. The player rolls an Investigation check to understand the circumstances of the ox's death
session_synopses.PAD_InvestigatedTiefling: The player finds a dead tiefling near the refugee's abandoned caravan. The tiefling was killed by the shadowcursed ox. The player rolls a Medicine check to determine the tiefling's death

TrueSoul_Dead.speaker: True Soul Korliss
TrueSoul_Dead.text: True Soul of the Absolute... Korliss by name...

session_synopses.TrueSoul_Dead: SwD dialog for dead True Soul that died of hunger/thirst while hiding from Shadow Mastiffs in the island of light. They used Continual Flame spell to make torches around them ever-burning, which allowed them to hide there indefinitely (until they died). The kicker - description of the spell says that each casting uses Ruby Dust worth 50gp, so, presumably, that's one rich True Soul.

AD_ShadowlandsComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_ShadowlandsComment.text: Darkness. Desolation. The Dark Lady's hand at work, mayhaps? HahaHA-HEE!
AD_ShadowlandsComment.context: NodeContext: Said with the laughing madness so common to the character.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowlandsComment: The spirit of the amulet comments on the state of the Shadowcurse and how it's effecting the land

000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.text: The Moonlantern's ours! Let's finish this and go home.

session_synopses.000_AD_TakesMoonlantern: Harper takes the moolantern from the harper.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.text: Big and ugly's down - grab the lantern!

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.text: You will die here - the Absolute wills it so!

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Follow close - the shadows are hungry. Do not stray from the light.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: One less blight in the darkness. A thousand more to conquer.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: At very least. For every beast we slay, the shadows spawn two more.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Gods - why so glum? We hit the cult where it hurts.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: A victory is a victory. Our heads are intact - and that's worth celebrating.

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.text: Perfect spot for an ambush. Get into position.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.context: NodeContext: Just watched your friend Lassandra die in combat

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Hyena
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Worg pup - sounds like a growl, but actually haltingly articulating a word (they can speak)

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena.text: Don't make eyes at me, you breech-blossom.
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Colourful goblin equivalent of 'shit-stain'. Said indignantly.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: Heard you're planning to infiltrate Moonrise, and take the fight to Ketheric. That'd be a tale for the ages.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: You got it. Here - I'll mark your map. But don't keep me waiting.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
