session_synopses.PAD_Prayer: Shadowheart recites verses of a prayer to Shar as she draws closer to Nightsong.This is a prayer that SH may have recited previously, now repeated as SH gets past the final hurdles to fulfill Shar's bidding. Urging herself on for the 'final lap'.
session_synopses.AD_Plaque2: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.AD_MartialPlaque: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
session_synopses.AD_NecroUnavailable: Nightsong indicates to the player that she cannot talk while Balthazar is unavailable
session_synopses.AD_EntrancePlaque: The player reads the plaque outside Nightsong's chamber. It instructs them to kill Nightsong in order to become a Dark Justiciar
session_synopses.ArriveAtShadowfell: After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell
session_synopses.AD_Plaque3: This is a plaque with narrator AD near the soul cage - before the final trial of killing the Selunite to finish Dark Justiciar training. There are total 3 of them so information needs to be divided nicely.
session_synopses.NecroAndNightsong: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowfellEntrance: Entered the final hall before entering the shadowfell in the shar temple. The area used to be used for Dark Justiciars to wash themselves, conduct last prayers and arming themselves before entering the waters into the shadowfell.
session_synopses.AD_DarknessPlaque: Narrator AD to read what is out on the plaque.
session_synopses.GatherYourParty: When a player attempts to enter the Shadowfell they will be reminded that they need to have all their party members present.If all their party are present a Ready Check will be started
session_synopses.PAD_FalseNightSpear: Looted fake spear of the night. Used by old justiciars to symbolically kill Nightsong.
session_synopses.AD_NecroAndNightsong: Nightsong and Balthazar banter before the player arrives into the Shadowfell.
session_synopses.PAD_EnteredShadowfell: PAD that plays after the end the cinematic upon entering the shadowfell in Nightsong's prison. Calls out to the player that they can jump down to the platforms below safely.
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_1: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and are reacting appropriately:- if they are Shadowheart and have Shar's spear- if they are Shadowheart and do not have Shar's spear- if they already knew Nightsong was a person- if they did not know Nightsong was a person
session_synopses.PAD_EntrancePlaqueReaction_2: The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.- reacting to Shadowheart’s desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if they’re just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.

NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.speaker: Balthazar
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.text: A cheap attack, just as I'm finally reunited with my masterwork? This will not stand.
NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro.context: InternalNodeContext: Balthazar is hostile to the player as they attacked him before the normal scene flow triggered.NodeContext: Furious.

session_synopses.NightsongPrison_PlayerAttackedNecro: Balthazar responds to the player's attack before becoming hostile

PAD_VoiceReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_VoiceReaction.text: A voice... is that Shar herself, who speaks...?

AD_Welcome.text: Welcome, child. Follow my voice, and prove your worth.

AD_Baptism.text: The end draws near. You show great potential - do not falter now.
One more test awaits. Descend to the Nightsong. Make a sacrifice. Rise again a Dark Justiciar.

session_synopses.PAD_VoiceReaction: Party reacts to Shar's voice in the temple and acknowledging it is Shar's voice.
session_synopses.AD_Welcome: The player is welcomed to the Shar Temple by a disembodied voice
session_synopses.AD_Baptism: A disembodied voice congratulates the player for reaching the entrance the inner sanctum of the Shar Temple. It urges the player too step into the water for their final test

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Another bowl, bearing the stains of an ancient blood offering.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue. Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the statue to begin the stealth trial in the Shar temple.

PAD_Ambush.speaker: Player
PAD_Ambush.context: NodeContext: Urgent/just been ambushed by a cloaker (a big bat/manta ray-looking creature)

session_synopses.PAD_Ambush: The party reacts to being ambushed by a Cloaker in the Gauntlet of Shar

AD_Plaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_Plaque.text: *Feed your bodies and rest your minds. Lady Shar needs her warriors strong and ready.*
AD_Plaque.context: NodeContext: Plaque text at barracks/dining hall of a Shar temple

session_synopses.AD_Plaque: This is a plaque placed in the section of barracks and dining halls and altar in Shar temple. Wise words to acolytes to have priestine thoughts and behavior

PAD_KillRats.speaker: Player
PAD_KillRats.text: These rats can't keep it up forever - just have to outlast them.

RatsUltimatum.speaker: Narrator
RatsUltimatum.text: *The rat utters a defiant hiss. Bloodlust fills its little black eyes.*
CinematicNodeContext: A cacophony of angry hisses and squeaks builds. From the surrounding darkness, a large number of rat eyes glow.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues after this dialogue.
RatsUltimatum.context: CinematicNodeContext: A cacophony of angry hisses and squeaks builds. From the surrounding darkness, a large number of rat eyes glow.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues after this dialogue.

RatsPanicked.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsPanicked.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - animal soundNodeContext: SFX animal sound - do not record

RatsPanicked.speaker: Narrator
RatsPanicked.text: *The rat seems agitated, afraid. It must know that you killed some of its peers.*

RatsPanicked.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - animal soundNodeContext: SFX animal sound - do not record

session_synopses.PAD_KillRats: Voicebark meant to inform players that they should just focus on killing rats.
session_synopses.RatsUltimatum: After killing too many rats, the swarm confronts the player in a chamber beneath the Orthon's lair. A fight ensues immediately afterwards.
session_synopses.RatsPanicked: After killing some of the rats, they become more panicked and aggressive - but also a litte more lucid- something the companions may pick up on. The may start to remember things -fragments of a memory, or a name on the tip of their tongue.
session_synopses.SpeakWithDead: The player turned the Last Justiciar back into a humanoid by killing his rats. The player then proceeded to kill the Last Justiciar and talk to him using Speak With Dead.The Last Justiciar witnessed the Orthon attack and has been using his rat form to hide for years

OnEnter.speaker: Player
OnEnter.text: Dark and freezing. What's hidden down here?

Sarcophagus1Plaque.speaker: Narrator
Sarcophagus1Plaque.text: *In darkness, beauty is equal and wealth unseen.*
Sarcophagus1Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque in the Shadow Temple.

Sarcophagus2Plaque.speaker: Narrator
Sarcophagus2Plaque.text: *The reign of night comes in a thousand falling leaves.*
Sarcophagus2Plaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque in the temple of shadow.

session_synopses.OnEnter: Player reaction upon descending into the Shar Temple for the first time.
session_synopses.Sarcophagus1Plaque: A plaque on one of Shar's sarcophagi.
session_synopses.Sarcophagus2Plaque: A sarcophagus plaque in Shar's temple.

PAD_MyrkulSymbol.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_KethericsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.text: Can she possibly be Ketheric's daughter?

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Balthazar, a necromancer lap dog of Ketheric Thorm's.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.text: Who knows what he may have up his rotten sleeve.

AD_IsobelsPlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_IsobelsPlaque.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at a plaque on the side of Isobel's tomb.NodeContext: Ssussun elgg oloth (SUSS-sun ELL-gh OL-oth) - Elvish for "Light slays darkness."

PAD_TempleSuspicion.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TempleSuspicion.text: There has to be more to this place. There has to be a reason I came to be here.
PAD_TempleSuspicion.context: NodeContext: Strong suspcion that she's somewhere important for her. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: That disc looks like it can move - a way forward?

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.text: Where will it bring us, though?

PAD_Mural_000.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_000.text: *Moonrise Towers. It makes the Urge hiss within. It was part of your disgrace, but how?*

PAD_NecromancersRoom.speaker: Player
PAD_NecromancersRoom.text: Bones everywhere... Someone's been engaging in dark rituals here.
PAD_NecromancersRoom.context: NodeContext: Astarion; as in 'water water everywhere, but not a drop to drink' (referring to a large amount of skeletons on display in a tomb

PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.speaker: Player
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.text: Nothing - it must have been disarmed.
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.context: NodeContext: Stepped on a trap, but nothing happened

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.speaker: Narrator
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.text: *Here lies Melodia Thorm, beloved wife and mother. Ai armiel telere maenen hir.*
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.context: NodeContext: Ah-less-ia /  Ay Army-el Teller-eh Man-en here

PAD_Mural_001.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_001.text: *Ketheric lost his daughter, but the bastard knows why you lost everything.*

session_synopses.PAD_MyrkulSymbol: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.
session_synopses.PAD_MakeshiftVessel: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsMap: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque: PAD for characters reacting to finding Isobels plaque in the Ketheric Mausoleum. Has 3 reaction states:- Already know Ketheric is Isobel's Father- Don't know aboutfamily relationship but have met Isobel- Don't know about family relationship and haven't met Isobel
session_synopses.PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro: Party reacts to a magic-mouth skull that projects Balthazar's voice, warning them to leave.
session_synopses.AD_IsobelsPlaque: Narrator/player to reading the plaque on Isobel's tomb . If they already know Isobel is Ketheric's daughter, the narrator reaction is different. The Elvish translates to 'Light slays darkness'.Note: the unusual structure of this is because the Origin PAD template is a greeting node and can't be connected to normally.
session_synopses.PAD_TempleSuspicion: Shadowheart comments on her suspicions that there is probably to the crypt than just a mausoleum. Hinting at the existence of the temple.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundDisc_2Players: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_000: Player interacts with the first mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the first piece of the story. This mural depicts Moonrise Towers in its heyday, before it turned to darkness. The player's comment varies, depending on whether they've been to MRT or not.
session_synopses.PAD_NecromancersRoom: Players enter for the first time inside the necromancer's room at the mausoleum. Bones are scattered about and arranged into strange totems, in a sign someone has been dabbling in dark magic.
session_synopses.PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate: Player steps with a pressure plate that should trigger the trap in the mausoleum but nothing happens.
session_synopses.PAD_KethericsWifePlaque: Reaction from player/narrator who interacts with the tomb of Isobel's mother (and Ketheric's wife).
session_synopses.PAD_Mural_001: Player interacts with the second mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the second piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm mourning at the tomb of his daughter (Isobel, though this is not revealed by the mural). The player's comment varies, depending on if they've met Ketheric or not.

001.speaker: Merregon
001.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001.speaker: Merregon
001.context: NodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Your efforts reveal nothing. If the merregon is angry at your attempted intrusion, it doesn't show.*

000.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000.speaker: Hoarding Merregon
000.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregon beckons the player towards its waresNodeContext: NB - the text between asterisks does not have to be vocalised/pronounced exactly as written, but rather treated as a guideline. Involuntary idle sound from the merregon. Raspy breath, chittering, sighes and moans etc.

000.speaker: Narrator
000.text: *The merregon resists your efforts. Most would be angry at such an intrusion, but this creature has no reaction at all.*

004.speaker: Narrator
004.text: *The merregon observes you blankly. Another near-empty mind.*

session_synopses.001: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive. Upon attempting to read its thoughts, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.
session_synopses.000: One of the merregon henchmen accompanying the orthon in his lair in the Shar Temple. This one acts as a trader and beastmaster for the Orthon's displacer beast. The player can trade, learn about the merregon's connection to the displacer via detect thoughts, and convince it to hand over the potions used to control the beast.
session_synopses.004: A merregon - a footsoldier from hell assigned to assist the Orthon ( a huge infernal bounty hunter). Outside of combat, the merregon is unspeaking and unreactive, uttering only slight groans and rattling sighes. Upon attempting to read the thoughts of one of its comrades, you realise it's little more than an empty vessel, without personality or thought.

AD_NightsongAttacked.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongAttacked.text: Unleash your wrath! It only fuels my fury.

AD_TauntPlayer.speaker: Nightsong
AD_TauntPlayer.text: What are you afraid of? Your own wicked heart?

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: 'The permiter of torches surrounding the inn flicker and go out, all at once. Shadowy figures start to move in between, descending on the inn'

CINE_NightsongsDeath.text: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.
CINE_NightsongsDeath.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stunned, lit only by candlelight, she strains to see out the window - then flinches as screams echo inside the inn. She turns to the door as the sound of combat grows closer. She's already reaching for a weapon when the candles go out - and in darkness we hear her door crashing open. Wide shot from the far side of Last Light's bridge: all sources of light flicker and die as the darkness closes in. The screaming goes on.

session_synopses.AD_NightsongAttacked: Nightsong cries in pain as she gets attacked by the player.
session_synopses.AD_TauntPlayer: Nightsong tries to goad the player into killing her
session_synopses.CINE_NightsongsDeath: After killing Nightsong the player sees the aftermath in Last Light

EntranceSharPlaque.speaker: Narrator
EntranceSharPlaque.text: *Shar. Singer of Eternal Night. Protector of the lost and forgotten.*
EntranceSharPlaque.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque inside the temple of shadow.

session_synopses.EntranceSharPlaque: The plaque below a painting of Shar covering burn victims with a dark shroud, shielding them from searing light.
session_synopses.HQ_Plaque1: This is the narrator AD played on a plaque in HQ center in Shar temple - a slightly secluded area that the player needs to spot and jump into. It is a big hall with control maps, and books, dedicated to HQ gatherings, linking to other Sharran temples and societies

PAD_Unlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_Unlocked.text: The disc is moving. This must lead to the next part of Shar's Gauntlet.
PAD_Unlocked.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if you received knowledge of the Shar trials from the disc altar.NodeContext: [Astarion: 'bloody' as in annoying, not 'lots of blood]

PAD_ShadowheartVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartVista.text: Lady Shar... so many must have toiled to make a visage so grand. It's beautiful...
PAD_ShadowheartVista.context: NodeContext: Overawed at the sight of a statue of liberty-sized representation of Shar, in  the heart of a huge temple.

session_synopses.PAD_Unlocked: Players unlock the disc/platform in the Shar temple for the first time.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartVista: Shadowheart sees the giant Shar Statue and lets it set in that she is in the temple of shar.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Pained/dazed/contrite. Has just been made an outcast by her goddess and forcibly ejected from her realm.

PAD_ShadowheartReturns.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.text: Shadowheart? What happened? You were missing for a moment.
PAD_ShadowheartReturns.context: NodeContext: Alarmed. The companion vanished on teleporting out of a place, only to reappear in a confused, distress state.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartReturns: The party reacts to Shadowheart's delayed return from the Shadowfell - Shar held her back to punish her for not killing Nightsong.

session_synopses.AD_WaitingAtGraveyard: Raphael is waiting at the graveyard for the players to warn them about a danger that's behind the door (the Orthon and his party inside the Shar temple).

PAD_VictimsDisplay.speaker: Player
PAD_VictimsDisplay.text: A very gory idea of art.

AD_FormLines.speaker: Yurgir
AD_FormLines.text: Form up ranks! Don't let anything get past you!
AD_FormLines.context: NodeContext: During combat. Bellowing orders to his merregon soldiers to change formation

AD_DisplacerGrowl.speaker: Displacer Beast
AD_DisplacerGrowl.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.NodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.

AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.speaker: Yurgir
AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.context: NodeContext: Surprised/somewhat distraught as his displacer beast companion turns on him mid-combat

session_synopses.PAD_VictimsDisplay: In Shar temple, there is a number of mutilated corpses - justiciars killed by Orthon. But he not only killed them, but he also created various installments of them, put them on spikes, hang them, etc
session_synopses.AD_FormLines: Orthon tells the merregons to get close to him during combat.
session_synopses.AD_DisplacerGrowl: The Displacer beast growls at the player if the player gets too close to it while it is in its idle behaviour if the Orthon is not hostile to the player.
session_synopses.AD_BetrayedByDisplacer: Orthon and Displacer fight between each other.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The bowl contains an ancient, rust-coloured bloodstain. It forms a neat disc, as if spilled calmly and willingly.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks at a large bowl being held by a Shar statue. Close-up of a dried blood stain in the base of the bowl.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise this as a trial, where initiates would prove themselves to Lady Shar. This one would challenge their combat prowess.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart-only narration. Visuals should favour her here.InternalNodeContext: SH-only narration

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Look upon the statue.
Vanquish your old life to receive my wisdom.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at the Shar statue before them and hear's Shar's disembodied voiceNodeContext: Haunting, disembodied voice offering guidance

session_synopses: For when a player interacts with the statue to begin the double combat trial in the Shar temple.

AD_DiscComment.text: Well if it isn't our Mistress of Pain. HahaHAHA, what anguish she has visited upon me!

session_synopses.AD_DiscComment: The spirit of the amulet comments on the Shar statue within the Shar Temple, near the moving disc. The Monk remenisces back to when he was tortured by Sharrans.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: *Reithwin House of Healing. Presiding Surgeon: Malus Thorm.*

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat.text: IF YOU WILL NOT GIVE, THEN I WILL TAKE!

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.text: YOU BROUGHT VIOLENCE. UNACCEPTABLE. BUT ALL CAN BE FORGIVEN. FOR THE RIGHT PRICE.
TollhouseMaster.context: NodeContext: howling with anger on first phrases - more reasonable on last two phrases, hoping to get some cash out of the situation

TollhouseMaster.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spotting you, Gerringothe lurches forward.NodeContext: a desperate, cacophonous howl

PAD_CormyrCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_CormyrCrate.text: Silks from Cormyr, it says. Empty, though.

AD_SafeSkeleton.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton.text: *A forgotten soul, trapped in a safe - but who put them there, and why?*

PAD_DalelandsCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_DalelandsCrate.text: Cheese from the Dalelands. Or what's left of it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They gave me what they had. Should I have let them leave?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: No. I thought there might be more to take. Hidden inside.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: I opened them. Searched inside them.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Why would you do something like that?

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Some wouldn't pay their dues. Some couldn't.
Face_Guilt.context: NodeContext: Rising disgust with each sentence - but a twinge of malice with the last few words

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: They paid a different price in the end.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt.text: Perhaps you'd feel less guilty if you paid for your crimes too.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Yes, yes. I have gold. So much gold. Take it.

Face_Guilt.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt.text: Take it all, whatever the cost.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat.text: NO MORE TAKING. GIVE. GIVE. GIVE!

PAD_ThayCrate.speaker: Player
PAD_ThayCrate.text: All the way from Thay. Jewels and gems, probably - one's still in there.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: Crates and caravans. Must be where tolls were collected.

PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.text: Well, we're not getting in this way.

Face_Obedience.speaker: Visage of Obedience
Face_Obedience.text: Report to the tollmaster. Pay the toll.

Face_Greed.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed.text: Leave it. LEAVE IT. It's MINE.

session_synopses.TollhouseMaster: Dialogue with the Toll collector.She will continuously, endlessly demand gold from the player. You can convince her to let you pass (hard persuade), or you will have to fight  (once you stop giving it gold, or once you run out of gold).
session_synopses.AD_Face_Regret: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regreting about not leaving this town.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Regret, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_CormyrCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Cormyr.
session_synopses.AD_TollhouseMaster: Tollhouse, Tollhouse Collector as she's hanging around by herself.
session_synopses.AD_SafeSkeleton: Player clicks on the skeleton that locked himself in the heavy safe in Tollhouse. This was am employee of Tollhouse and this way he hoped to wait out the fallout of Shadowcurse. But have died in that safe in dramatic way.
session_synopses.AD_Face_Cowardice: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.
session_synopses.PAD_DalelandsCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Dalelands.
session_synopses.Face_Guilt: The Visage of Guilt, hovering in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).
session_synopses.AD_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque: Plaque in the Tollhouse, outside a room full of confiscated items.
session_synopses.PAD_ThayCrate: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Thay.
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL
session_synopses.PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed: You've just clicked on a plaque beside a door in the Tollhouse, which tells you that room is for confiscated items. The way into the room is blocked by vegetation/fallen masonry (don't be specific).
session_synopses.Face_Obedience: The Visage of Obedience is standing near the entrance of the tollhouse. All Visages pretty much ignore the player, they are more like shadow reflections of some aspects of the Tollhouse Collector, you are basically seeing some thoughts/memories.
session_synopses.Face_Greed: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of items it confiscated that became inaccessible once the shadows and vines moved in and blocked the room off.

PAD_Warning.speaker: Player
PAD_Warning.text: Clustered fires and tents - the Absolute's army is camped here. Better not press my luck.

PAD_Arrested.speaker: Player
PAD_Arrested.text: Well. This is quite the mess you've gotten us into.
PAD_Arrested.context: InternalNodeContext: If the first char chose to procceed in TWN_MarchingArmy_Arrest then here the second char makes a sarcastic comments about it (like, "you really thought they wouldn't catch us")

session_synopses.PAD_Warning: The player approaches an area with a lot of tents & camp fires. It's the army of the Aboslute. The character comments that it's better to keep a safe distance from them.
session_synopses.PAD_Arrested: The dialog after we got arrested and thrown in Moonrise Prison / Corpse Pit. The companion (if present) is sarcastic about our previous statement (before being captured) where we said that we would be able to sneak past the army without any issues.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*Here - House of Healing
West - Baldur's Gate
East - Central Square*

TownIntroduction.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Before Arabella can finish, there is an eeries noise coming from behind her. Arabella turns to look as two Shadows emerge from the ground menacingly.NodeContext: About to continue from 'Hey, I know you! You're - ' with a proper introduction, but is interrupted by shadow creature spawning from ground.

TownIntroduction.text: CinematicNodeContext: The creatures groan menacingly and prepare to lunge
TownIntroduction.context: CinematicNodeContext: The creatures groan menacingly and prepare to lunge

TownIntroduction.speaker: Arabella
TownIntroduction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arbaella starts moving her hands to cast a spell, in the manner of Jaheira casting entangling vines.

TownIntroduction.text: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella casts her spell. Before the creatures can attack, vines rise from the ground and wrap around them, entangling them to her right
TownIntroduction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella casts her spell. Before the creatures can attack, vines rise from the ground and wrap around them, entangling them to her right

TownIntroduction.speaker: Narrator
TownIntroduction.text: *You remember this girl - Arabella, from the druids' grove, the thief Kagha tried to punish.*

AD_Arabella.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella.text: Mum, pops - can you hear me?
AD_Arabella.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

AD_Arabella.speaker: Arabella
AD_Arabella.context: NodeContext: Calling out, trying to find her parents.

session_synopses.TownIntroduction: Player comes upon a familiar face in the cursed land: Arabella, the girl they rescued from the snake in act 1. She has developed powers and is rooting shadow-creatures. She promises you to teach you this entangling power if you save her parents, who are lost.
session_synopses.AD_Arabella: Arabella calls out for her parents from within the cursed land, or speaks to herself to calm herself down.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundParents: PAD when seeing Arabella's parents. One version if it is the mother, one if it is the father, and one if you never met them.

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text:
*North - Thorm Mausoleum
South - South Reithwin
East - Masons' Guild
West - House of Healing*

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: Rambling nonsense. Why someone would be drawn to this is beyond me.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on reading"Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she reads the book or when another character does that.

AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap.text: A dead githyanki. The corpse may hold something useful.

session_synopses.AD_DeadGithyankiBodyWithMap: Laezel directs the player's attention to the dead body.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: 'Rascal.'? 'Jagoda.'? All these collars belonged to pets.

session_synopses.PAD: Character interacts with a pile of pet collars.Different reaction depending on whether the user has read the missing pet posters before or not.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *The curse has been lifted, the lands cleansed of the shadows. Ketheric's reign of living death is over.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players leave SCL by the Risen Road. They look back to see beams of light breaking through the clouds.-The curse has been lifted. The clouds above part, and a powerful beam of moonlight shines through and illuminates the town centre where the statue of Ketheric stood. It is now shattered.

LeavingAct.speaker: Narrator
LeavingAct.text: *Your courage has been tested, and in this, at least, you have triumphed.*
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut to close up of the shattered statue. An enormous silver tree bursts through the ground where the statue once stood, silver leaves/fruits sprouting, and the light from above intensifies as the shadows disperse.

LeavingAct.text: CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey
LeavingAct.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut back to party, with Halsin in shot, looking across the rejuvenating region. Halsin takes front and centre, looking back across the 'healed'vista, overjoyed, and then the party turn and continue their journey

PAD_ArmyLeft.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmyLeft.text: The Absolute's armies are on the march - and Baldur's Gate is their target.

session_synopses.LeavingAct: Scene of players leaving SCL to travel to Intermezzo. This scene triggers when the party leave Moonrise Tower after defeating Ketheric. There are two variants. One where the curse has been lifted, one where the curse hasn't been lifted.If the curse has been lifted, Halsin and/or Art Cullagh will be present at Moonrise if alive, and will tell players that the quest has succeeded, and that when they leave Moonrise, they'll see the restults. They tell you to wrap up your business here first. This happens in the dialogues for those characters, not here.If the curse hasn't been lifted, players see a vista of the shadow-cursed lands on leaving Moonrise, and move on toward the Risen Road.
session_synopses.PAD_ArmyLeft: Comment on how the absolute army left. Reactivity if you saw them previously or not.

AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.speaker: Ch'r'ai Tska'an
AD_Caster_000_CombatStarts.text: W'wargaz failed to kill you. I won't make the same mistake!

PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.speaker: Player
PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction.text: Gith hunters. That must be why that device sounded out.

session_synopses.PAD_RealizeGithRadarFunction: Players realize the Gith Radar must have beeped to alert them about the incoming Gith attack.Tries to play on Laezel first if she is nearby and available.

AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_SuccessfulSurgery_Combat.text: A successful procedure, Shar be praised!

AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Leech_Combat.text: Behold - the leech, for draining humours most foul.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_002_Combat.text: The subject resists. Next instrument, good sister.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Here to see the doctor? Are we poorly? Are we desperately poorly?

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Not so well. But well enough to wait. Join the line, and you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist.context: CinematicNodeContext: The nurse 'looks' you over, assessing your condition.InternalNodeContext: Upon investigation, deduces that you're not that sick.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist.text: I don't have time to wait - I need to see the doctor right now.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Yes yes, but all must wait. The doctor's hands are full.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Join the line - you will be seen.
Reception_Receptionist.context: NodeContext: with a touch of desperation

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.context: CinematicNodeContext: Disgusted reaction to player's pretend illness.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Sister Sinda
Reception_Receptionist.text: Plague! Pest! In line, or leave.

Reception_Receptionist.speaker: Player
Reception_Receptionist.text: Enough of this - I'm going in.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_004_Combat.text: This flesh must be flayed. The next instrument, sister.

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Don't call the doctor yet! I've got potions, sutures - I know I can do this...
Reception_CorpseTender.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't see you coming, but from the sound of your footsteps thinks you might be the doctor. NodeContext: The nurse is panicking assuming you are a patient

Reception_CorpseTender.speaker: Sister Lidwin
Reception_CorpseTender.text: Oh, you're a patient. This is the children's ward - triage is back that way.
Reception_CorpseTender.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices you. NodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices the player.

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_001_Combat.text: Sister. The first instrument, if I may.

AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Trepan_Combat.text: Blood has pooled in the brain. I must open the cranium!

AD_Surgeon.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon.text: Only with unwavering hand can we show our subject mercy.
AD_Surgeon.context: NodeContext: speaking to nurses as he demonstrates surgical procedure

AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.speaker: Sister Anya
AD_Surgeon_InstrumentRequest_003_Combat.context: NodeContext: 'Sister?' = expectantly, asking for his next surgical tool.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: A house of healing, for all the good it does anyone now.

AD_ResponseToSurgeon_000_Combat.speaker: Sister Hunna
AD_ResponseToSurgeon_000_Combat.text: The master surgeon's will is my honour.

AD_Surgeon_Syringe_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Syringe_Combat.text: A sure remedy for a sickened mind.

AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.speaker: Malus Thorm
AD_Surgeon_Bonesaw_Combat.text: Still yourself. The saw's teeth will open the way for her shadow.

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |H... Hi? What are you doing at my home?|

RooftopRaven.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven.text: |This literally is just a rooftop though? I just stumbled into you|

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |Yeah. But I still live here. And you're invading on my living space|

RooftopRaven.speaker: Player
RooftopRaven.text: |Actually, I just wanted your feedback on my stand up routine? It goes something like that...|

RooftopRaven.speaker: ade29cab-0f28-42f5-b5bb-4f8911171a9d
RooftopRaven.text: |Sure, you do seem like a nice enough person. Consider yourself my guest, but nothing more|

ZealousAssistant_003.speaker: Sister Anya
ZealousAssistant_003.text: Be still darling. Let Sister Anya comfort you.

ZealousAssistant_000_AD.speaker: Sister Hunna
ZealousAssistant_000_AD.text: The gift of... nothing. Her gift.
ZealousAssistant_000_AD.context: NodeContext: Her mind is gone. She should sound haunting.

session_synopses.Reception_Receptionist: Receptionist at the entrance of the Hospital. She's mostly supposed to be there for flavor and to provide directions to the operating room (down the hallway and under the observation area.) If you piss her off or try to circumvent her to see the doctor, she'll fight you.
session_synopses.Reception_CorpseTender: A nurse is tending to the corpse of Arabella's father, one of the rejected/failed experiments of the Surgeon. She is insistent that it makes sense, even though the corpse is well... a corpse. The player can trade with this nurse.
session_synopses.AD_Surgeon: Surgeon in the Hospital in the Cursed Town operates on a goblin restrained in a chair.OR comments about patients if the goblin is dead (released).
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Hospital in SCL
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_003: One of the nurses in the Hospital
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_002: One of the nurses in the HospitalMUTE (maybe just can't talk or maybe lost her tongue to the surgeon)
session_synopses.ZealousAssistant_000_AD: Nurses only speak if the Surgeon is dead.Case #1 They operated on the Surgeon and killed him.Case #2.The player killed the Surgeon and ran away. The nurses now have ADs.

PAD.speaker: Astarion
PAD.text: Is that blood on the shelves? Probably cold and congealed - urgh.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Unpleasantly surprised to find a room of jars filled with blood

session_synopses.PAD: Astarion reacting on approaching Blood Bank.

PAD_IdentifiedGrave.speaker: Player
PAD_IdentifiedGrave.text: Some of our war dead, from so long ago. Buried in haste when we had to flee the curse.
PAD_IdentifiedGrave.context: NodeContext: Solemn, Spotting some old makeshift graves.

session_synopses.PAD_IdentifiedGrave: Player comes across some old, rushed graves for the war dead from a hundred years ago. They comment depending on how much they're aware of previous events in the region, Jaheira and Halsin, as veterans of this very fight, know the full context.

PAD_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_1P.text: Prayers, charms, battle cries - the Harpers' work. They were primed for combat.

session_synopses.PAD_1P: AD about a wall with protective charms and prayers written by Harpers attacking Ketheric's Outpost.

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: D-do mess our pardon. Our master d-distiller spill's quite the caused.

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: Now settle your mind, chum, and get your shine on. Be will it what?

Brewer_Zombie_01.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01.text: M-moon Mountain Dark, coming righ-righ-right up. A man of proper t-taste!
Brewer_Zombie_01.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Research notes. They describe a powerful venom extracted from a rare purple worm. Distiller Thisobald Thorm sought to create a fatal poison using the worm's gullet.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He procured several parts of a gullet, but rinsed one in error. The poison he brewed was noxious - but not fatal.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *He devoted months to formulating a deadly poison with the remaining ingredients, without success.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *After exhaustive experimentation, he was able to make a near-deadly extract from the glands. But to complete his poison, Thisobald required one last ingredient:*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *The book's index reveals corpse roses may grow near tombs, mausoleums, and particularly redolent cadavers.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Thisobald enlisted a courier from Baldur's Gate to obtain corpse rose petals and other ingredients and deliver them to a covert location.*

ResearchNotes.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes.text: *Unfortunately, a deep purple stain darkens the final page, obscuring the parcel's destination.*

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.text: Finally, there might be some more drink for the rest of us.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.text: Drink has torn his mortal stitches - Say, hey, for the pub!
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.context: NodeContext: referring to the brewer, who just died

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat.text: Imps! No, no - illusions, delusions, delirium.

PAD_Entrance_1P.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P.text: That sign above. This must be a brewery - or distillery.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Wait... what am I doing here again?

AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat.text: Drink of dead, dying, death. Order up.

PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted.text: Expect anything - he's been cursed to the Hells and back.

PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.text: Is that... yes! His hallucinations made real.

PAD_BrewerDead.speaker: Player
PAD_BrewerDead.text: Pity we had to kill him. He seemed more lonely than cruel.

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: One day I'll get there... one day...

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: What are you doing up here on this stage?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: Isn't it obvious! I'm a... I stand on a stage, pretending...
Brewer_Zombie_04.context: NodeContext: hesitant, trying to find the right words, but is cursed to forget

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: You mean you're an actor? How did you end up here?

Brewer_Zombie_04.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04.text: I was... performing... and then the lights went out. I'm waiting for the curtain call.

Brewer.text: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drags itself to a bar counter, on which are two full mugs.
Brewer.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drags itself to a bar counter, on which are two full mugs.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Drink, gulp it down, wet your whistle. Tell your story.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse.

Brewer.speaker: Player
Brewer.text: What in all Nine Hells are you?

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Son of Thorm. Sot of Sword Coast.

Brewer.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer.text: Go on. Cheers, bottoms up, down the hatch.
Brewer.context: NodeContext: still an offer, but becoming more of a threat

Brewer_Zombie_03.speaker: Blighted Troubador
Brewer_Zombie_03.text:
No time to waste, we should be drinkin'
Hey! for the pub
Ho! for the pub
We'll soon be stinkin' drunk!

AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat.text: Too much drink. Too much drunk.

AD_Brewer_Fire_Combat.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Fire_Combat.text: Fire and flames, blaze and burn.

Brewer_Zombie_02.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02.text: I don't know you... perhaps I forgot you.

session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_01: A zombie who was once the waiter. He is stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.
session_synopses.ResearchNotes: Research notes of the Brewer.He experimented with different poisons on different creatures, trying to figure out the most effective ways of poisoning them. This book also contains info about his attempts to create a Purple Worm Poison.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_02: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.He's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and has been drained of most of his emotions. What lingers is a sense of sadness - he misses the joy of the old times.
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_03: Zombie Patron #3 in BreweryTroubador singing/chanting drinking rhymes.
session_synopses.AD_HalflingsSign: Plaque that says "Halfings and gnomes order here."
session_synopses.PAD_Entrance_1P: VB that is played when you approach the Distillery in SCL
session_synopses.AD_Brewer: Brewer in Shadow-Cursed Town. Waiting for someone to join him as he stands behind the bar.The brewer was once an ordinary person, but has been twisted by the shadowcurse and is now a huge, bloated monstrosity. He speaks in fragments, and is menacing but with an air of melancholy. He wants to drink until he forgets everything, and would like to bring everyone into oblivion with him.
session_synopses.AD_WaningMoonSign: Click on the sign of Distillery in TWN
session_synopses.AD_Brewer_Zombie_04: Zombie Patron #4 in Brewery. Used to be an actor, was on her way to Baldur's Gate. Like the other patrons in the brewery, she's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and is mostly drained of emotions.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted: Played at the start of a fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
session_synopses.PAD_BrewerDead: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Brewer that is son of Ketheric and shadow-curse mutated. This one is played when we defeat him
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_04: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. This is an actor whose heart was set on the Five Flagons in Baldur's Gate, but he got lost in his cups here.
session_synopses.Brewer: Dialog with the Brewer. He is a bloated creature who asks us to drink ourselves into oblivion with him. Player choices lead either to combat, or to the brewer drinking himself until he explodes.Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse to become a monstrous drunk. He speaks in fragments, swinging between melancholy, menace, and humour. Extra emphasis and derangment on bold words.
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_03: Billy, one of the zombie patrons of the brewer used to be a troubador. Here he is bellowing out a drinking song - may be improvises as a song or chanted.
session_synopses.Brewer_Zombie_02: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.

PAD.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD.text: A Selûne prayer book. Hmm, well she didn't answer any prayers from this place.

session_synopses.PAD: ShadowHeart reacting on picking up "Selune Prayer Book"Location: SCL -> Tollhouse - Seized Inventory Room.She reacts both when she picks up the book or when another character does that.

SharAltar.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of shar. Resting upon it is an ornate dagger.
SharAltar.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of shar. Resting upon it is an ornate dagger.

SharAltar.speaker: Narrator
SharAltar.text: *An altar to Shar. It appears to seek pray, and a blood offering - your blood.*

SharAltar.speaker: Player
SharAltar.text: Take up the dagger, recite Shar's wisdom and offer blood from your arm.

CinematicNodeContext: With the ritual dagger in their right hand, the player quickly sliced their left palm, wincing in pain.InternalNodeContext: Rewards will appear on two pedestals in gameplay following this node.
SharAltar.context: CinematicNodeContext: With the ritual dagger in their right hand, the player quickly sliced their left palm, wincing in pain.InternalNodeContext: Rewards will appear on two pedestals in gameplay following this node.

PAD_ExitLocked.speaker: Player
PAD_ExitLocked.text: Stuck. There's no leaving without a fight.

session_synopses.Plaque_001_AD: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.
session_synopses.SharAltar: Altar dedicated to Shar. Has a ritual dagger on it. The altar appears when you activate three tapestries with dogmas of Shar.When the altar appears the door that leads outside gets locked. You need to recite the dogmas at the altar and spill your blood on it to open the door.If you a follower of shar you can do it with not issue and get a blessing.If you aren't a follower of shar, but you passed all the saving throws you can also get a blessing of shar by reciting the dogmas.If you didn't pass all the saving throws and perform a ritual then the guardians appear because you aren't worthy.If you desecrate the altar by taking the dagger then the guardians appear no matter who you are.
session_synopses.PAD_ExitLocked: This PAD is played when you try to exit the secret room beneath the central square after three guardians were revealed to you, but before you defeated them.
